ai-an10:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:1.1.3_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:1.2.1_0: “Sir, what is the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics?”
ai-an10:1.2.2_0: “Ānanda, the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.”
ai-an10:1.3.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of having no regrets?”
ai-an10:1.3.2_0: “Joy is the purpose and benefit of having no regrets.”
ai-an10:1.4.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of joy?”
ai-an10:1.5.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of rapture?”
ai-an10:1.6.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of tranquility?”
ai-an10:1.7.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of bliss?”
ai-an10:1.8.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of immersion?”
ai-an10:1.9.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing?”
ai-an10:1.10.1_0: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of disillusionment?”
ai-an10:1.10.2_0: “Knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:1.11.1_0: So, Ānanda, the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics is not having regrets.
ai-an10:1.11.2_0: Joy is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.
ai-an10:1.11.3_0: Rapture is the purpose and benefit of joy.
ai-an10:1.11.4_0: Tranquility is the purpose and benefit of rapture.
ai-an10:1.11.5_0: Bliss is the purpose and benefit of tranquility.
ai-an10:1.11.6_0: Immersion is the purpose and benefit of bliss.
ai-an10:1.11.7_0: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of immersion.
ai-an10:1.11.8_0: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:1.11.9_0: Knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:1.11.10_0: So, Ānanda, gradually become the best kind of ethics.”
ai-an10:1.11.11_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-an10:2.1.1_0: “In ethical conduct, mendicants, you shouldn’t make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.3_0: It’s only natural to an ethical person who is ethical when not regretted.
ai-an10:2.1.4_0: When you have regrets, you should not make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.6_0: It’s only natural that joy springs up when you have no regrets.
ai-an10:2.1.7_0: When you’re joyful, you should not make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.9_0: It’s only natural that rapture arises.
ai-an10:2.1.10_0: When you’re joyful, and good intention that shouldn’t be grounded:
ai-an10:2.1.12_0: It’s only natural that the body springs up.
ai-an10:2.1.13_0: When the body is tranquil and you need not make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.15_0: It’s only natural that bliss is felt when you feel bliss.
ai-an10:2.1.16_0: When you’re happy, you should not make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.18_0: It’s only natural for the mind to be immersed in samādhi when you feel bliss.
ai-an10:2.1.19_0: When you have immersion, you should not make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.21_0: It’s only natural to truly know and see.
ai-an10:2.1.22_0: Truly knowing and seeing, you should not make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.24_0: It’s only natural to become disillusioned and dispassionate when you truly know and see.
ai-an10:2.1.25_0: When you’re disillusioned and dispassionate you need not make a wish:
ai-an10:2.1.27_0: It’s only natural to realize the knowledge and vision of freedom when you’re disillusioned and dispassionate.
ai-an10:2.2.1_0: And so, mendicants, the knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:2.2.2_0: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:2.2.3_0: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of immersion.
ai-an10:2.2.4_0: Immersion is the purpose and benefit of bliss.
ai-an10:2.2.5_0: Bliss is the purpose and benefit of tranquility.
ai-an10:2.2.6_0: Tranquility is the purpose and benefit of rapture.
ai-an10:2.2.7_0: Rapture is the purpose and benefit of joy.
ai-an10:2.2.8_0: Joy is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.
ai-an10:2.2.9_0: Not having regrets is the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics.
ai-an10:2.2.10_0: And so, mendicants, thinking and consider those qualities as they become full of joy and sorrow.”
ai-an10:3.1.1_0: “Mendicants, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
ai-an10:3.1.2_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for joy.
ai-an10:3.1.3_0: When there is no joy, one who lacks joy has destroyed a vital condition for rapture.
ai-an10:3.1.4_0: When there is no rapture, one who lacks rapture has destroyed a vital condition for tranquility.
ai-an10:3.1.5_0: When there is no tranquility, one who lacks tranquility has destroyed a vital condition for bliss.
ai-an10:3.1.6_0: When there is no bliss, one who lacks bliss has destroyed a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an10:3.1.7_0: When there is no right immersion, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an10:3.1.8_0: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:3.1.9_0: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:3.1.10_0: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
ai-an10:3.1.11_0: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
ai-an10:3.1.12_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint. ...
ai-an10:3.1.13_0: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:3.2.1_0: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
ai-an10:3.2.2_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for joy.
ai-an10:3.2.3_0: When there is joy, one who has fulfilled joy has fulfilled a vital condition for rapture.
ai-an10:3.2.4_0: When there is rapture, one who has fulfilled rapture has fulfilled a vital condition for tranquility.
ai-an10:3.2.5_0: When there is tranquility, one who has fulfilled tranquility has fulfilled a vital condition for bliss.
ai-an10:3.2.6_0: When there is bliss, one who has fulfilled bliss has fulfilled a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an10:3.2.7_0: When there is right immersion, one who has fulfilled right immersion has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an10:3.2.8_0: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:3.2.9_0: When there is disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:3.2.10_0: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
ai-an10:3.2.11_0: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
ai-an10:3.2.12_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint.
ai-an10:3.2.13_0: When there is dispassion, one who has fulfilled dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”

ai-an10:4.1.3_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint. ...
ai-an10:4.1.4_0: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.

ai-an10:4.1.7_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint. ...
ai-an10:4.1.8_0: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:4.2.1_0: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
ai-an10:4.2.2_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint.
ai-an10:4.2.3_0: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:4.2.4_0: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
ai-an10:4.2.5_0: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
ai-an10:4.2.6_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint.
ai-an10:4.2.7_0: When there is dispassion, one who has fulfilled dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
ai-an10:5.1.1_0: There Venerable Ānanda addressed the mendicants ...
ai-an10:5.1.2_0: “Reverends, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
ai-an10:5.1.3_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for joy.
ai-an10:5.1.4_0: When there is no joy, one who lacks joy has destroyed a vital condition for rapture.
ai-an10:5.1.5_0: When there is no rapture, one who lacks rapture has destroyed a vital condition for tranquility.
ai-an10:5.1.6_0: When there is no tranquility, one who lacks tranquility has destroyed a vital condition for bliss.
ai-an10:5.1.7_0: When there is no bliss, one who lacks bliss has destroyed a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an10:5.1.8_0: When there is no right immersion, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an10:5.1.9_0: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:5.1.10_0: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:5.1.11_0: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
ai-an10:5.1.12_0: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
ai-an10:5.1.13_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint. ...
ai-an10:5.1.14_0: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:5.2.1_0: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
ai-an10:5.2.2_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for joy.
ai-an10:5.2.3_0: When there is joy, one who has fulfilled joy has fulfilled a vital condition for rapture.
ai-an10:5.2.4_0: When there is rapture, one who has fulfilled rapture has fulfilled a vital condition for tranquility.
ai-an10:5.2.5_0: When there is tranquility, one who has fulfilled tranquility has fulfilled a vital condition for bliss.
ai-an10:5.2.6_0: When there is bliss, one who has fulfilled bliss has fulfilled a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an10:5.2.7_0: When there is right immersion, one who has fulfilled right immersion has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an10:5.2.8_0: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:5.2.9_0: When there is disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an10:5.2.10_0: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
ai-an10:5.2.11_0: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
ai-an10:5.2.12_0: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint.
ai-an10:5.2.13_0: When there is dispassion, one who has fulfilled dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
ai-an10:6.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha ... and asked him,
ai-an10:6.1.2_0: “Could it be, sir, that a mendicant might gain a state of immersion like this. They wouldn’t perceive earth in earth, water in water, fire in fire, or air in air. And they wouldn’t perceive the dimension of infinite space in the dimension of infinite space, the dimension of infinite consciousness in the dimension of infinite consciousness, the dimension of nothingness in the dimension of nothingness, or the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. And they wouldn’t perceive this world in this world, or the other world in the other world. And yet they would still perceive. And yet they would still perceive.”
ai-an10:6.1.2_1: Or would I perceive myself and consolation?”
ai-an10:6.1.3_0: “It could be, Ānanda, that a mendicant might gain a state of immersion like this. They wouldn’t perceive earth in earth, water in water, fire in fire, or air in air. And they wouldn’t perceive the dimension of infinite space in the dimension of infinite space, the dimension of infinite consciousness in the dimension of infinite consciousness, the dimension of nothingness in the dimension of nothingness, or the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. And they wouldn’t perceive this world in this world, or the other world in the other world. And yet they would still perceive. And yet they would still perceive. And yet they would still perceive.
ai-an10:6.1.3_1: but they perceive it as horses.”
ai-an10:6.2.1_1: Or would I perceive myself and consolation?”
ai-an10:6.3.2_0: ‘This is peaceful; this is sublime—that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, cessation, extinguishment.’
ai-an10:6.3.3_0: That’s how a mendicant might gain a state of immersion like this. They wouldn’t perceive earth in earth, water in water, fire in fire, or air in air. And they wouldn’t perceive the dimension of infinite space in the dimension of infinite space, the dimension of infinite consciousness in the dimension of infinite consciousness, the dimension of nothingness in the dimension of nothingness, or the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. And they wouldn’t perceive this world in this world, or the other world in the other world. And yet they would still perceive. And yet they would still perceive. And yet they would still perceive.
ai-an10:6.3.3_1: but they perceive it as horses.”
ai-an10:7.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-an10:7.1.2_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
ai-an10:7.1.2_1: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
ai-an10:7.2.1_0: “Could it be, reverend Sāriputta, that a mendicant might gain a state of immersion like this? They wouldn’t perceive earth in earth, water in water, fire in fire, or air in air. And they wouldn’t perceive the dimension of infinite space in the dimension of infinite space, the dimension of infinite consciousness in the dimension of infinite consciousness, the dimension of nothingness in the dimension of nothingness, or the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. And they wouldn’t perceive this world in this world, or the other world in the other world. And yet they would still perceive. And yet they would still perceive.”
ai-an10:7.2.1_1: Or would I perceive myself and consolation?”
ai-an10:7.3.1_1: He should not see the next world,
ai-an10:7.3.1_2: but they perceive it as horses.”
ai-an10:7.4.1_1: Or would I perceive myself and consolation?”
ai-an10:7.4.2_0: “Reverend Ānanda, one time I was staying right here at Sāvatthī in the Dark Forest.
ai-an10:7.4.3_0: There I gained a state of immersion like this. I didn’t perceive earth in earth, water in water, fire in fire, or air in air. And I didn’t perceive the dimension of infinite space in the dimension of infinite space, the dimension of infinite consciousness in the dimension of infinite consciousness, the dimension of nothingness in the dimension of nothingness, or the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. And I didn’t perceive this world in this world, or the other world in the other world. And yet I still perceived.”
ai-an10:7.5.1_0: “But at that time what did Reverend Sāriputta perceive?”
ai-an10:7.5.2_0: “One perception arose in me and another perception ceased: ‘The cessation of continued existence is extinguishment. The cessation of continued existence is extinguishment.’
ai-an10:7.5.3_0: Suppose there was a burning pile of twigs. One flame would arise and another would cease.
ai-an10:7.5.4_0: In the same way, one perception arose in me and another perception ceased: ‘The cessation of continued existence is extinguishment. The cessation of continued existence is extinguishment.’
ai-an10:7.5.5_0: At that time I perceived that the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment.”
ai-an10:8.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant is faithful but not ethical.
ai-an10:8.1.4_0: ‘How can I become faithful and ethical?’
ai-an10:8.1.5_0: When the mendicant is faithful and ethical, they’re complete in that respect.
ai-an10:8.2.1_0: A mendicant is faithful and ethical, but not educated. ...
ai-an10:8.2.4_0: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance ...
ai-an10:8.2.5_0: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly ...
ai-an10:8.2.6_0: they’re not an expert in the training ...
ai-an10:8.2.7_0: they don’t get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty ...
ai-an10:8.2.8_0: they don’t realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:8.2.11_0: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’
ai-an10:8.3.1_0: When they’re faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,
ai-an10:8.3.3_0: A mendicant with these ten qualities is all around in every respect.”
ai-an10:9.0.3_0: 9. Inspiring All Around: the Peaceful Liberations
ai-an10:9.1.1_0: “A mendicant is faithful, but not ethical. ...
ai-an10:9.1.5_0: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance ...
ai-an10:9.1.6_0: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly ...
ai-an10:9.1.7_0: they’re not an expert in the training ...
ai-an10:9.1.8_0: they don’t have direct meditative experience of the peaceful liberations that are formless, transcending form ...
ai-an10:9.1.9_0: they don’t realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:9.1.12_0: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’
ai-an10:9.2.1_0: When they’re faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,
ai-an10:9.2.3_0: A mendicant with these ten qualities is all around in every respect.”
ai-an10:10.0.3_0: 10. Inspiring All Around: the Three Knowledges
ai-an10:10.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant is faithful but not ethical.
ai-an10:10.1.4_0: ‘How can I become faithful and ethical?’
ai-an10:10.1.5_0: When the mendicant is faithful and ethical, they’re complete in that respect.
ai-an10:10.2.1_0: A mendicant is faithful and ethical, but not learned ...
ai-an10:10.2.4_0: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance ...
ai-an10:10.2.5_0: they’re not an expert in the training ...
ai-an10:10.2.6_0: they don’t recollect their many kinds of past lives ...
ai-an10:10.2.6_1: There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an10:10.2.6_2: And he practiced the same way.
ai-an10:10.2.7_0: they don’t, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, see sentient beings passing away and being reborn ...
ai-an10:10.2.7_1: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an10:10.2.8_0: they don’t realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:10.2.11_0: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who recollects their many kinds of past lives, one who with features and details?
ai-an10:10.2.11_1: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so, with features and details.
ai-an10:10.2.11_2: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an10:10.2.11_3: Having realized it with his own insight.’
ai-an10:10.3.1_0: When they are faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who recollects their many kinds of past lives, one who with features and details,
ai-an10:10.3.1_1: They recollect their many kinds of past lives, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an10:10.3.1_2: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an10:10.3.3_0: A mendicant with these ten qualities is all around in every respect.”
ai-an10:10.3.5_0: The first sub-chapter on respectfully is finished.
ai-an10:11.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five factors, using and frequenting lodgings with five factors, will soon realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:11.2.1_0: And how does a mendicant have five factors?
ai-an10:11.2.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
ai-an10:11.2.3_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-an10:11.2.4_0: They are rarely ill or unwell. Their stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
ai-an10:11.2.5_0: They’re not devious or deceitful. They reveal themselves honestly to the Teacher or sensible spiritual companions.
ai-an10:11.2.6_0: They live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities.
ai-an10:11.2.7_0: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-an10:11.2.8_0: That’s how a mendicant has five factors.
ai-an10:11.3.1_0: And how does a lodging have five factors?
ai-an10:11.3.2_0: It’s when a lodging is neither too far nor too near, but convenient for coming and going.
ai-an10:11.3.3_0: It’s not bothered by people by day, and at night it’s quiet and still.
ai-an10:11.3.4_0: There’s little disturbance from flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles.
ai-an10:11.3.5_0: While staying in that lodging the necessities of life—robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick—are easy to come by.
ai-an10:11.3.6_0: And in that lodging there are several senior mendicants who are very learned, knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines.
ai-an10:11.3.8_0: ‘Why, sir, does it say this? What does that mean?’
ai-an10:11.3.9_0: Those venerables clarify what is unclear, reveal what is obscure, and dispel doubt regarding the many doubtful matters.
ai-an10:11.3.10_0: That’s how a lodging has five factors.
ai-an10:11.3.11_0: A mendicant with five factors, using and frequenting lodgings with five factors, will soon realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:11.3.11_1: and live having realized it with their own insight.”
ai-an10:11.3.12_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-an10:12.1.1_0: “Mendicants, in this teaching and training a mendicant who has given up five factors and possesses five factors is called consummate, accomplished, a supreme person.
ai-an10:12.1.2_0: And how has a mendicant given up five factors?
ai-an10:12.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
ai-an10:12.1.4_0: That’s how a mendicant has given up five factors.
ai-an10:12.2.1_0: And how does a mendicant have five factors?
ai-an10:12.2.2_0: It’s when they have the entire spectrum of the master’s ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:12.2.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has five factors.
ai-an10:12.3.1_0: In this teaching and training a mendicant who has given up five factors and possesses five factors is called consummate, accomplished, a supreme person.
ai-an10:12.4.4_0: are not found in a mendicant at all.
ai-an10:13.1.3_0: The five lower fetters and the five higher fetters.
ai-an10:13.1.4_0: What are the five lower fetters?
ai-an10:13.1.5_0: identity view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, sensual desire, and ill will.
ai-an10:13.1.6_0: These are the five lower fetters.
ai-an10:13.2.1_0: What are the five higher fetters?
ai-an10:13.2.2_0: Desire for rebirth in the realm of luminous form, desire for rebirth in the formless realm, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance.
ai-an10:13.2.3_0: These are the five higher fetters.
ai-an10:14.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a monk or nun who has not given up five kinds of emotional barrenness and has not cut off five emotional shackles can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:14.2.1_0: What are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up?
ai-an10:14.2.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant has doubts about the Teacher. They’re not uncertain, undecided, or lacking confidence.
ai-an10:14.2.3_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an10:14.2.4_0: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.
ai-an10:14.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has doubts about the teaching ...
ai-an10:14.3.4_0: A mendicant is angry and upset with their spiritual companions, resentful and closed off.
ai-an10:14.3.5_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an10:14.3.6_0: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.
ai-an10:14.3.7_0: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they haven’t given up.
ai-an10:14.4.1_0: What are the five emotional shackles they haven’t cut off?
ai-an10:14.4.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
ai-an10:14.4.3_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an10:14.4.4_0: This is the first emotional shackle.
ai-an10:14.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t free of greed for the body ...
ai-an10:14.5.2_0: They’re not free of greed for form ...
ai-an10:14.5.3_0: They eat as much as they like until their belly is full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing ...
ai-an10:14.5.4_0: They lead the spiritual life hoping to be reborn in one of the orders of gods, thinking:
ai-an10:14.5.4_1: ‘By this precept by this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life, may I become one of the gods!’
ai-an10:14.5.5_0: Any mendicant who leads the spiritual life hoping to be reborn in one of the orders of gods:
ai-an10:14.5.5_1: ‘By this precepts or observances, I will incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.’
ai-an10:14.5.6_0: This is the fifth emotional shackle.
ai-an10:14.5.7_0: These are the five emotional shackles they haven’t cut off.
ai-an10:14.6.1_0: A monk or nun who has not given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has not cut off these five emotional shackles can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:14.7.1_0: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only decline.
ai-an10:14.7.2_0: In the same way, monk or nun who has not given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has not cut off these five emotional shackles can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:14.8.1_0: A monk or nun who has given up five kinds of emotional barrenness and has cut off five emotional shackles can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:14.9.1_0: What are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they’ve given up?
ai-an10:14.9.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant has no doubts about the Teacher. They’re not uncertain, undecided, or lacking confidence.
ai-an10:14.9.3_0: This being so, their mind inclines toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an10:14.9.4_0: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.

ai-an10:14.10.4_0: A mendicant is not angry and upset with their spiritual companions, not resentful or closed off.
ai-an10:14.10.5_0: This being so, their mind inclines toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an10:14.10.6_0: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.
ai-an10:14.10.7_0: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness they’ve given up.
ai-an10:14.11.1_0: What are the five emotional shackles they’ve cut off?
ai-an10:14.11.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant is rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
ai-an10:14.11.3_0: This being so, their mind inclines toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an10:14.11.4_0: This is the first emotional shackle.
ai-an10:14.12.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t free of greed for the body ...
ai-an10:14.12.2_0: They’re free of greed for form ...
ai-an10:14.12.3_0: They don’t eat as much as they like until their belly is full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing ...
ai-an10:14.12.4_0: They don’t lead the spiritual life hoping to be reborn in one of the orders of gods, thinking:
ai-an10:14.12.4_1: ‘By this precept by this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life, may I become one of the gods!’
ai-an10:14.12.5_1: This was their mind inclined to keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an10:14.12.6_0: This is the fifth emotional shackle.
ai-an10:14.12.7_0: These are the five emotional shackles they’ve cut off.
ai-an10:14.13.1_0: A monk or nun who has given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has cut off these five emotional shackles can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:14.14.1_0: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only grow.
ai-an10:14.14.2_0: In the same way, a monk or nun who has given up these five kinds of emotional barrenness and has cut off these five emotional shackles can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.”
ai-an10:15.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, is said to be the best of all sentient beings—be they footless, with two feet, four feet, or many feet; with form or formless; with perception or without perception or with neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-an10:15.1.2_0: In the same way, all skillful qualities are rooted in diligence and meet at diligence, and diligence is said to be the best of them.
ai-an10:15.1.2_1: diligence is said to be the best of them.
ai-an10:15.2.1_0: The footprints of all creatures that walk can fit inside an elephant’s footprint, so an elephant’s footprint is said to be the biggest of them all.
ai-an10:15.2.2_0: In the same way, all skillful qualities are rooted in diligence and meet at diligence, and diligence is said to be the best of them.
ai-an10:15.2.2_1: diligence is said to be the best of them.
ai-an10:15.3.1_0: The rafters of a bungalow all lean to the peak, slope to the peak, and meet at the peak, so the peak is said to be the topmost of them all.
ai-an10:15.3.2_0: In the same way, all skillful qualities are rooted in diligence and meet at diligence, and diligence is said to be the best of them.
ai-an10:15.3.2_1: diligence is said to be the best of them.
ai-an10:15.4.1_0: Of all kinds of fragrant root, spikenard is said to be the best.
ai-an10:15.5.1_0: Of all kinds of fragrant heartwood, red sandalwood is said to be the best.
ai-an10:15.6.1_0: Of all kinds of fragrant flower, jasmine is said to be the best.
ai-an10:15.7.1_0: All lesser kings are vassals of a wheel-turning monarch, so the wheel-turning monarch is said to be the foremost of them all.
ai-an10:15.8.1_0: The radiance of all the stars is not worth a sixteenth part of the moon’s radiance, so the moon’s radiance is said to be the best of them all.
ai-an10:15.9.1_0: After the rainy season the sky is clear and cloudless. And when the sun rises, it dispels all the darkness from the sky as it shines and glows and radiates.
ai-an10:15.10.1_0: Just as when the great rivers—the Ganges, the Yamunā, the Aciravatī, the Sarabhū, or the Mahī—reach the ocean, they’re said to be the best of them all.
ai-an10:15.10.2_0: In the same way, all skillful qualities are rooted in diligence and meet at diligence, and diligence is said to be the best of them.
ai-an10:16.0.3_0: 16. Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods
ai-an10:16.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these ten people are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an10:16.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:16.1.3_0: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; a Buddha awakened for themselves; one freed both ways; one freed by wisdom; a personal witness; one attained to view; one freed by faith; a follower by faith; a follower of the teachings; a member of the spiritual family.
ai-an10:16.1.4_0: These are the ten people who are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.”
ai-an10:17.1.3_0: There are ten qualities that serve as protector.
ai-an10:17.1.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:17.1.5_0: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an10:17.1.7_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.2.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has good friends, companions, and associates. ...
ai-an10:17.3.2_0: When a mendicant has good friends,
ai-an10:17.3.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They’re patient, and take instruction respectfully. ...
ai-an10:17.4.2_0: When a mendicant is easy to admonish,
ai-an10:17.4.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is deft and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties for their spiritual companions, understanding how to go about things in order to complete and organize the work.
ai-an10:17.5.2_0: When a mendicant is able to examine their spiritual companions,
ai-an10:17.5.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.6.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant loves the teachings and is a delight to converse with, being full of joy in the teaching and training. ...
ai-an10:17.6.2_0: When a mendicant loves the teachings,
ai-an10:17.6.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.7.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They are strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities. ...
ai-an10:17.7.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.8.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is content with any kind of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. ...
ai-an10:17.8.2_0: When a mendicant is content with any kind of robes,
ai-an10:17.8.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.9.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
ai-an10:17.9.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.10.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-an10:17.10.3_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:17.11.3_0: These are the ten qualities that serve as protector.”
ai-an10:18.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:18.2.3_0: There are ten qualities that serve as protector.
ai-an10:18.2.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:18.2.5_0: Firstly, a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, with good behavior and supporters. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an10:18.2.6_0: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.
ai-an10:18.2.6_1: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.
ai-an10:18.2.7_0: But they can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:18.2.8_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
ai-an10:18.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reinforcing them by recitation, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically.
ai-an10:18.3.2_0: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

ai-an10:18.12.4_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-an10:18.12.5_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-an10:19.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ten noble abodes, whether in noble abodes, whether they’re the noble ones, or they will arrive at their destination.
ai-an10:19.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:19.1.3_0: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.
ai-an10:19.1.4_0: These are the ten noble abodes, whether in noble abodes, or disciples of the noble ones.”
ai-an10:20.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Kurus, where they have a town named Kammāsadamma.
ai-an10:20.1.2_0: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-an10:20.2.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ten noble abodes, whether in noble abodes, whether they’re the noble ones, or they will arrive at their destination.
ai-an10:20.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:20.2.3_0: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.
ai-an10:20.3.1_0: And how has a mendicant given up five factors?
ai-an10:20.3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
ai-an10:20.3.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has given up five factors.
ai-an10:20.4.1_0: And how does a mendicant possess six factors?
ai-an10:20.4.2_0: It’s a mendicant who, when they see a sight with their eyes, is neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-an10:20.4.3_0: When hearing a sound with the ear ...
ai-an10:20.4.4_0: When smelling an odor with the nose ...
ai-an10:20.4.5_0: Tasting a flavor with his tongue ...
ai-an10:20.4.6_0: Feeling a touch with his body ...
ai-an10:20.4.7_0: When they know a thought with their mind, they’re neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-an10:20.4.8_0: That’s how a mendicant possesses six factors.
ai-an10:20.5.1_0: And how has a mendicant a single guard?
ai-an10:20.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant’s heart is guarded by mindfulness.
ai-an10:20.5.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has a single guard.
ai-an10:20.6.1_0: And how does a mendicant have four supports?
ai-an10:20.6.2_0: After appraisal, a mendicant uses some things, endures some things, avoids some things, and gets rid of some things.
ai-an10:20.6.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has four supports.
ai-an10:20.7.1_0: And how has a mendicant eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth?
ai-an10:20.7.2_0: Different ascetics and brahmins have different idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth. For example:
ai-an10:20.7.3_0: the cosmos is eternal, or not eternal, or finite, or infinite; the soul and the body are the same thing, or they are different things; after death, a Realized One exists, or doesn’t exist, or both exists and doesn’t exist, or neither exists nor doesn’t exist.
ai-an10:20.7.4_0: A mendicant has dispelled, eliminated, thrown out, rejected, let go of, given up, and relinquished all these.
ai-an10:20.7.5_0: That’s how a mendicant has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth.
ai-an10:20.8.1_0: And how does a mendicant become scratched?
ai-an10:20.8.2_0: It’s when they’ve given up searching for sensual pleasures, for continued existence, and for a spiritual life.
ai-an10:20.8.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is full of impurities.
ai-an10:20.9.1_0: And how does a mendicant have unsullied intentions?
ai-an10:20.9.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up intentions of sensuality, malice, and cruelty.
ai-an10:20.9.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has unsullied intentions.
ai-an10:20.10.1_0: And how has a mendicant physical process?
ai-an10:20.10.2_0: It’s when, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-an10:20.10.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has stilled the physical process.
ai-an10:20.11.1_0: And how is a mendicant well freed in mind?
ai-an10:20.11.2_0: It’s when a mendicant’s mind is freed from greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an10:20.11.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is well freed in mind.
ai-an10:20.12.1_0: And how is a mendicant well freed by wisdom?
ai-an10:20.12.2_0: It’s when a mendicant understands: ‘I’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.’
ai-an10:20.12.2_1: ‘I’ve given up delusion, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.’
ai-an10:20.12.3_0: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is well freed by wisdom.
ai-an10:20.13.1_0: Mendicants, whether in the past, future, or present, all the noble ones of noble abodes abide in these same ten noble abodes.
ai-an10:20.13.2_0: Mendicants, all the noble ones will in the future will come together, all of them will abodes abide in these ten noble abodes.
ai-an10:20.13.3_0: Mendicants, whatever noble abodes you have ten noble abodes abide in these same ten noble abodes.
ai-an10:20.13.4_0: These are the ten noble abodes, whether in noble abodes, or disciples of the noble ones.”
ai-an10:20.13.6_0: The second sub-chapter on nakedness is finished.
ai-an10:21.1.1_0: “Mendicants, towards evening the lion, king of beasts, emerges from his den,
ai-an10:21.1.2_0: and after leaving the village, she returned.
ai-an10:21.1.3_0: looks all around the four directions,
ai-an10:21.1.4_0: and roars his lion’s roar three times.
ai-an10:21.1.5_0: and roars his lion’s roar three times.
ai-an10:21.1.7_0: Thinking: ‘May I not accidentally injure any little creatures that happen to be in the wrong place.’
ai-an10:21.2.1_0: ‘Lion’ is a term for the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an10:21.3.1_0: The Realized One possesses ten powers of a Realized One. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an10:21.3.3_0: Firstly, the Realized One truly understands the possible as possible, and the impossible as impossible.
ai-an10:21.3.4_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. Relying on this he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an10:21.4.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons.
ai-an10:21.4.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an10:21.5.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands where all paths of practice lead.
ai-an10:21.5.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an10:21.6.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the world with its many and diverse elements.
ai-an10:21.6.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an10:21.7.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the diverse attitudes of sentient beings.
ai-an10:21.7.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an10:21.8.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the faculties of other sentient beings and other individuals after comprehending them with his mind.
ai-an10:21.8.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an10:21.9.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands corruption, cleansing, and emergence regarding the absorptions, liberations, immersions, and attainments.
ai-an10:21.9.2_1: This is the power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an10:21.10.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One recollects many kinds of past lives. That is: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths; many eons of the world contracting, many eons of the world expanding, many eons of the world contracting and expanding. He remembers: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ Thus he recollects his many past lives, with features and details.
ai-an10:21.10.1_1: They recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an10:21.11.1_0: Furthermore, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Realized One sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. He understands how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds:
ai-an10:21.11.1_1: ‘These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an10:21.11.1_2: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an10:21.11.1_3: They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an10:21.12.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:21.12.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an10:21.13.1_0: These are the ten powers of a Realized One that the Realized One possesses. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.”
ai-an10:21.13.2_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-an10:22.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:22.1.1_2: Sitting to one side, the Buddha said to Ānanda:
ai-an10:22.2.1_0: “Ānanda, I claim to be assured regarding the teachings that lead to realizing by insight the various different hypotheses.
ai-an10:22.2.2_0: So I am able to teach the Dhamma in appropriate ways to different people. Practicing accordingly, when something exists they’ll know it exists. When it doesn’t exist they’ll know it doesn’t exist. When something is inferior they’ll know it’s inferior. When it’s superior they’ll know it’s superior. When something is not supreme they’ll know it’s not supreme. When it is supreme they’ll know it’s supreme.
ai-an10:22.2.3_0: And they will know or see or realize it in whatever way it should be known or seen or realized. This is possible.
ai-an10:22.2.4_0: But this is the unsurpassable knowledge, that is: truly knowing each and every case.
ai-an10:22.2.5_0: And Ānanda, I say that there is no other knowledge better or finer than this.
ai-an10:22.3.1_0: The Realized One possesses ten powers of a Realized One. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an10:22.3.3_0: Firstly, the Realized One truly understands the possible as possible, and the impossible as impossible.
ai-an10:22.3.4_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. Relying on this he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an10:22.4.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons.
ai-an10:22.5.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands where all paths of practice lead.
ai-an10:22.6.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the world with its many and diverse elements.
ai-an10:22.7.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the diverse attitudes of sentient beings.
ai-an10:22.8.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the faculties of other sentient beings and other individuals after comprehending them with his mind.
ai-an10:22.9.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands corruption, cleansing, and emergence regarding the absorptions, liberations, immersions, and attainments.
ai-an10:22.10.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One recollects many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an10:22.10.1_1: There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an10:22.11.1_0: Furthermore, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Realized One sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place.
ai-an10:22.11.1_1: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an10:22.12.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:22.12.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One.
ai-an10:22.12.2_1: And they realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having realized it with their own insight.
ai-an10:22.13.1_0: These are the ten powers of a Realized One that the Realized One possesses. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.”
ai-an10:23.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.
ai-an10:23.1.2_0: There are things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.
ai-an10:23.1.3_0: There are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
ai-an10:23.2.1_0: And what are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech?
ai-an10:23.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has committed a certain unskillful offense by way of body.
ai-an10:23.2.3_0: When sensible spiritual companions say this they say to them:
ai-an10:23.2.4_0: ‘Venerable, you’ve committed a certain unskillful offense by way of body.
ai-an10:23.2.5_0: Please give up that bad bodily conduct and develop good bodily conduct.’
ai-an10:23.2.6_0: When spoken to by their sensible spiritual companions they give up that bad bodily conduct and develop good bodily conduct.
ai-an10:23.2.7_0: These are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.
ai-an10:23.3.1_0: And what are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body?
ai-an10:23.3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has committed a certain unskillful offense by way of speech.
ai-an10:23.3.3_0: When sensible spiritual companions say this they say to them:
ai-an10:23.3.4_0: ‘Venerable, you’ve committed a certain unskillful offense by way of speech.
ai-an10:23.3.5_0: Please give up that bad verbal conduct and develop good verbal conduct.’
ai-an10:23.3.6_0: When spoken to by their sensible spiritual companions they give up that bad verbal conduct and develop good verbal conduct.
ai-an10:23.3.7_0: These are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.
ai-an10:23.4.1_0: And what are the things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom?
ai-an10:23.4.2_0: Greed should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
ai-an10:23.4.9_0: and stinginess are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
ai-an10:23.5.1_0: Nasty jealousy should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
ai-an10:23.5.3_0: It’s when a householder or their child is prospering in money, grain, silver, or gold.
ai-an10:23.5.4_0: And a bondservant or dependent thinks:
ai-an10:23.5.5_0: ‘Oh, may that householder or their child not prosper in money, grain, silver, or gold!’
ai-an10:23.5.6_0: But they don’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-an10:23.5.7_0: And some other ascetic or brahmin thinks:
ai-an10:23.5.8_0: ‘Oh, may that ascetic or brahmin not receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.’
ai-an10:23.6.1_0: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
ai-an10:23.6.3_0: It’s when a faithless person wishes to be known as faithful.
ai-an10:23.6.4_0: An unethical person wishes to be known as ethical.
ai-an10:23.6.5_0: An uneducated person wishes to be known as learned.
ai-an10:23.6.6_0: A lover of company wishes to be known as secluded.
ai-an10:23.6.7_0: A lazy person wishes to be known as energetic.
ai-an10:23.6.8_0: An unmindful person wishes to be known as mindful.
ai-an10:23.6.9_0: A person without immersion wishes to be known as having immersion.
ai-an10:23.6.10_0: A witless person wishes to be known as wise.
ai-an10:23.6.11_0: A person who has not ended the defilements wishes to be known as having ended the defilements.
ai-an10:23.6.13_0: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
ai-an10:23.7.1_0: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.
ai-an10:23.7.10_0: or corrupt wishes master them and keep going.
ai-an10:23.7.12_0: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
ai-an10:23.7.13_0: They don’t understand what that venerable does not know or see,
ai-an10:23.7.21_0: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:23.8.1_0: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.
ai-an10:23.8.10_0: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant and keep going.
ai-an10:23.8.12_0: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.
ai-an10:23.8.13_0: This venerable has no ill will ...
ai-an10:23.8.21_0: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’”
ai-an10:24.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the land of the Cetis at Sahajāti.
ai-an10:24.1.2_0: There Venerable Mahācunda addressed the mendicants,
ai-an10:24.2.1_0: “Reverends, a mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge says:
ai-an10:24.2.3_0: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.2.12_0: or corrupt wishes. They can know that
ai-an10:24.2.13_0: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.2.14_0: They don’t understand what that venerable does not know or see,
ai-an10:24.2.22_0: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:24.3.1_0: A mendicant who makes a declaration of development:
ai-an10:24.3.2_0: ‘I have developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
ai-an10:24.3.3_0: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.3.12_0: or corrupt wishes. They can know that
ai-an10:24.3.13_0: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.3.14_0: They don’t understand what that venerable does not know or see,
ai-an10:24.3.22_0: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:24.4.1_0: Asdvinciation, a mendicant whose knowledge is the development of knowledge and conduct can develop
ai-an10:24.4.2_0: ‘I see a teaching that I have developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
ai-an10:24.4.3_0: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.4.12_0: or corrupt wishes. They can know that
ai-an10:24.4.13_0: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.4.14_0: They don’t understand what that venerable does not know or see,
ai-an10:24.4.22_0: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:24.5.1_0: Suppose a poor, needy, and penniless person was to declare themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.
ai-an10:24.5.2_0: But when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.
ai-an10:24.5.4_0: ‘This person declares themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy, but they are in fact poor, penniless, and needy.’
ai-an10:24.5.6_0: Because when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.
ai-an10:24.6.1_0: In the same way, take a mendicant whose knowledge and vision of knowledge and conduct, saying:
ai-an10:24.6.2_0: ‘I see a teaching that I have developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
ai-an10:24.6.3_0: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.6.12_0: or corrupt wishes. They can know that
ai-an10:24.6.13_0: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
ai-an10:24.6.14_0: They don’t understand what that venerable does not know or see,
ai-an10:24.6.22_0: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:24.7.1_0: A mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge says:
ai-an10:24.7.3_0: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.
ai-an10:24.7.12_0: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant who is going to heaven.
ai-an10:24.7.13_0: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.
ai-an10:24.7.14_0: This venerable has no ill will ...
ai-an10:24.7.22_0: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:24.8.1_0: A mendicant who makes a declaration of development:
ai-an10:24.8.2_0: ‘I have developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
ai-an10:24.8.3_0: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.
ai-an10:24.8.12_0: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant who is going to heaven.
ai-an10:24.8.13_0: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.
ai-an10:24.8.14_0: This venerable has no ill will ...
ai-an10:24.8.22_0: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:24.9.1_0: Asdvinciation, a mendicant whose knowledge is the development of knowledge and conduct can develop
ai-an10:24.9.2_0: ‘I see a teaching that I have developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
ai-an10:24.9.3_0: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.
ai-an10:24.9.12_0: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant who is going to heaven.
ai-an10:24.9.13_0: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.
ai-an10:24.9.14_0: This venerable has no ill will ...
ai-an10:24.9.22_0: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’
ai-an10:24.10.1_0: Suppose a rich, affluent, and wealthy person was to declare themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.
ai-an10:24.10.2_0: And whenever it came time to make a payment they were able to come up with the money, grain, silver, or gold.
ai-an10:24.10.4_0: ‘This person declares themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy, and they are in fact rich, affluent, and wealthy.’
ai-an10:24.10.6_0: Because when it came time to make a payment they were able to come up with the money, grain, silver, or gold.
ai-an10:24.11.1_0: In the same way, take a mendicant whose knowledge and vision of knowledge and conduct, saying:
ai-an10:24.11.2_0: ‘I see a teaching that I have developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
ai-an10:24.11.3_0: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.
ai-an10:24.11.12_0: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant who is going to heaven.
