ai-an10:54.2.3_0: But if they don’t see any dirt or blemish there, they’re happy with that, thinking:
ai-an10:54.2.5_0: In the same way, checking is very helpful for a mendicant’s skillful qualities.
ai-an10:54.2.6_0: ‘Do I have internal serenity of heart or not? Do I have the higher wisdom of discernment of principles or not?’
ai-an10:54.3.1_0: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows this:
ai-an10:54.3.2_0: ‘I have serenity but not discernment.’ Grounded on serenity, they should practice meditation to get discernment.
ai-an10:54.3.3_0: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.
ai-an10:54.4.1_0: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows this:
ai-an10:54.4.2_0: ‘I have discernment but not serenity.’ Grounded on discernment, they should practice meditation to get serenity.
ai-an10:54.4.3_0: After some time they have both discernment and serenity.
ai-an10:54.5.1_0: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows this:
ai-an10:54.5.2_0: ‘I have neither serenity nor discernment.’ In order to get those skillful qualities, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:54.5.3_0: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire.
ai-an10:54.5.4_0: If they’re extinguished in this way, they’ll apply outstanding enthusiasm or effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:54.5.5_0: In the same way, in order to get those skillful qualities, that person should apply outstanding enthusiasm ...
ai-an10:54.5.6_0: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.
ai-an10:54.6.1_0: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows this:
ai-an10:54.6.2_0: ‘I have both serenity and discernment.’ Grounded on those skillful qualities, they should practice meditation further to end the defilements.
ai-an10:54.7.1_0: I say that there are two kinds of robes:
ai-an10:54.7.2_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-an10:54.7.3_0: I say that there are two kinds of almsfood:
ai-an10:54.7.4_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-an10:54.7.5_0: I say that there are two kinds of lodging:
ai-an10:54.7.6_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-an10:54.7.7_0: I say that there are two kinds of market town:
ai-an10:54.7.8_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-an10:54.7.9_0: I say that there are two kinds of country:
ai-an10:54.7.10_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-an10:54.7.11_0: I say that there are two kinds of people:
ai-an10:54.7.12_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-an10:54.8.1_0: I say that there are two kinds of robes:
ai-an10:54.8.2_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.8.3_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an10:54.8.4_0: Well, should you know of a robe:
ai-an10:54.8.5_0: ‘This robe-cloth causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.’ You should not cultivate that kind of robe.
ai-an10:54.8.6_0: Well, should you know of a robe:
ai-an10:54.8.7_0: ‘This robe I cultivate the kind of robe. You should cultivate that kind of robe.
ai-an10:54.8.8_0: I say that there are two kinds of robes:
ai-an10:54.8.9_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.8.10_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an10:54.9.1_0: I say that there are two kinds of almsfood:
ai-an10:54.9.2_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.9.3_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an10:54.9.4_0: Well, should you know of a alms-food:
ai-an10:54.9.5_0: ‘When I cultivate this kind of alms-food, unskillful qualities grow, and skillful qualities decline.’ You should not cultivate that kind of alms-food.
ai-an10:54.9.6_0: Well, should you know of a alms-food:
ai-an10:54.9.7_0: ‘When I cultivate this kind of alms-food, unskillful qualities decline, and skillful qualities grow.’ You should cultivate that kind of alms-food.
ai-an10:54.9.8_0: I say that there are two kinds of almsfood:
ai-an10:54.9.9_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.9.10_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an10:54.10.1_0: I say that there are two kinds of lodging:
ai-an10:54.10.2_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.10.3_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an10:54.10.4_0: Well, should you know of a dwelling:
ai-an10:54.10.6_0: Well, should you know of a dwelling:
ai-an10:54.10.7_0: ‘This lodging causes unskillful qualities to decline, and skillful qualities grow.’ You should cultivate that kind of lodging.
ai-an10:54.10.8_0: I say that there are two kinds of lodging:
ai-an10:54.10.9_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.10.10_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an10:54.11.1_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of market town:
ai-an10:54.11.2_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.11.3_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an10:54.11.4_0: Whereas, should you know of a village or town:
ai-an10:54.11.5_0: ‘When I frequent this market town, unskillful qualities grow, and skillful qualities decline.’ You should not frequent that kind of village or town.
ai-an10:54.11.6_0: Whereas, should you know of a village or town:
ai-an10:54.11.7_0: ‘When I frequent this market town, unskillful qualities decline, and skillful qualities grow.’ You should frequent that kind of market town.
ai-an10:54.11.8_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of market town:
ai-an10:54.11.9_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.11.10_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an10:54.12.1_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of country:
ai-an10:54.12.2_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.12.3_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an10:54.12.4_0: Whereas, should you know of a country:
ai-an10:54.12.5_0: ‘When I cultivate this kind of country, unskillful qualities grow, and skillful qualities decline.’ You should not cultivate that kind of country.
ai-an10:54.12.6_0: Whereas, should you know of a country:
ai-an10:54.12.7_0: ‘When I cultivate this kind of country, unskillful qualities decline, and skillful qualities grow.’ You should cultivate that kind of country.
ai-an10:54.12.8_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of country:
ai-an10:54.12.9_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.12.10_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an10:54.13.1_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of people:
ai-an10:54.13.2_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.13.3_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an10:54.13.4_0: Whereas, should you know of a person:
ai-an10:54.13.5_0: ‘When I frequent this person, unskillful qualities grow, and skillful qualities decline.’ You should not frequent that kind of person.
ai-an10:54.13.6_0: Whereas, should you know of a person:
ai-an10:54.13.7_0: ‘When I frequent this person, unskillful qualities decline, and skillful qualities grow.’ You should frequent that kind of person.
ai-an10:54.13.8_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of people:
ai-an10:54.13.9_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.’
ai-an10:54.13.10_0: That’s what I said, and this is why he said it.”
ai-an10:55.2.1_0: “Reverends, they speak of a person liable to decline,
ai-an10:55.2.2_0: and one not liable to decline.
ai-an10:55.2.3_0: But how did the Buddha define a person liable to decline, and one not liable to decline?”
ai-an10:55.2.4_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, we would travel a long way to learn the meaning of this statement in the presence of Venerable Sāriputta.
ai-an10:55.2.5_0: May Venerable Sāriputta himself please clarify the meaning of this.
ai-an10:55.2.6_0: Sir, may the mendicants remember this. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-an10:55.3.1_0: “Then listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an10:55.4.1_0: “How did the Buddha define a person liable to decline?
ai-an10:55.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t get to hear a teaching they haven’t heard before. They forget those teachings they have heard. They don’t keep rehearsing the teachings they’ve already got to know. And they don’t come to understand what they haven’t understood before.
ai-an10:55.4.3_0: That’s how the Buddha defined a person liable to decline.
ai-an10:55.5.1_0: And how did the Buddha define a person not liable to decline?
ai-an10:55.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant gets to hear a teaching they haven’t heard before. They remember those teachings they have heard. They keep rehearsing the teachings they’ve already got to know. And they come to understand what they haven’t understood before.
ai-an10:55.5.3_0: That’s how the Buddha defined a person not liable to decline.
ai-an10:55.6.1_0: If a mendicant isn’t skilled in the ways of another’s mind, then they should train themselves: ‘I will be skilled in the ways of my own mind.’
ai-an10:55.7.1_0: And how is a mendicant skilled in the ways of thought?
ai-an10:55.7.2_0: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and they check their own reflection in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of dust. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.
ai-an10:55.7.3_0: But if they don’t see any dirt or blemish there, they’re happy with that, thinking:
ai-an10:55.7.5_0: In the same way, checking is very helpful for a mendicant’s skillful qualities.
ai-an10:55.7.6_0: ‘Is contentment often found in me or not? Is kind-heartedness often found in me or not? Is freedom from dullness and drowsiness often found in me or not? Is calm often found in me or not? Is confidence often found in me or not? Is love often found in me or not? Is purity of mind often found in me or not? Is internal joy with the teaching found in me or not? Is internal serenity of heart found in me or not? Is the higher wisdom of discernment of principles found in me or not?’
ai-an10:55.8.1_0: Suppose a mendicant, while checking, doesn’t see any of these skillful qualities in themselves. In order to get them they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.8.2_0: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire.
ai-an10:55.8.3_0: If they’re extinguished in this way, they’ll apply outstanding enthusiasm or effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.8.4_0: In the same way, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm to get those skillful qualities ...
ai-an10:55.9.1_0: Suppose a mendicant, while checking, sees some of these skillful qualities in themselves, but doesn’t see others. Grounded on the skillful qualities they see, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness in order to get the skillful qualities they don’t see.
ai-an10:55.9.2_0: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire.
ai-an10:55.9.3_0: If they’re extinguished in this way, they’ll apply outstanding enthusiasm or effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.9.4_0: In the same way, grounded on the skillful qualities they see, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm to get those skillful qualities they don’t see.
ai-an10:55.10.1_0: But suppose a mendicant, while checking, sees all of these skillful qualities in themselves. Grounded on all these skillful qualities they should practice meditation further to end the defilements.”
ai-an10:56.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.
ai-an10:56.1.3_0: The perceptions of ugliness, death, repulsiveness of food, dissatisfaction with the whole world, impermanence, suffering in impermanence, not-self in suffering, giving up, fading away, and cessation.
ai-an10:56.1.4_0: These ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.”
ai-an10:57.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.
ai-an10:57.1.3_0: The perceptions of impermanence, not-self, death, repulsiveness of food, dissatisfaction with the whole world, a skeleton, a worm-infested corpse, a livid corpse, a split open corpse, and a bloated corpse.
ai-an10:57.1.4_0: These ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.”
ai-an10:58.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow another path were to ask you:
ai-an10:58.1.2_0: ‘Reverends, all things have what as their root? What produces them? What is their origin? What is their meeting place? What is their chief? What is their ruler? What is their overseer? What is their core? What is their culmination? What is their final end?’ How would you answer them?”
ai-an10:58.1.3_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-an10:58.1.3_1: He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-an10:58.1.3_2: Sir, may the Buddha himself please clarify the meaning of this. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-an10:58.2.1_0: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an10:58.3.1_0: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow another path were to ask you:
ai-an10:58.3.2_0: ‘Reverends, all things have what as their root? What produces them? What is their origin? What is their meeting place? What is their chief? What is their ruler? What is their overseer? What is their core? What is their culmination? What is their final end?’
ai-an10:58.3.3_0: When questioned by wanderers who follow other paths, that’s how you should answer them:
ai-an10:58.3.4_0: ‘Reverends, all things are rooted in desire. Attention produces them. Contact is their origin. Feeling is their meeting place. Immersion is their chief. Mindfulness is their ruler. Wisdom is their overseer. Freedom is their core. They culminate in the deathless. And extinguishment is their final end.’
ai-an10:58.3.5_0: When questioned by wanderers who follow other paths, that’s how you should answer them.”
ai-an10:59.1.2_0: ‘Our minds will be consolidated as they were when we went forth, and arisen bad unskillful qualities will not occupy our minds.
ai-an10:59.1.3_0: Our minds will be consolidated in the perceptions of impermanence, not-self, ugliness, and drawbacks. Knowing what is just and unjust in the world, our minds will be consolidated in that perception. Knowing about continued existence and ending of existence in the world, our minds will be consolidated in that perception. Knowing the origination and ending of the world, our minds will be consolidated in that perception. Our minds will be consolidated in the perceptions of giving up, fading away, and cessation.’
ai-an10:59.2.1_0: When your minds are consolidated in these ten perceptions, you can expect one of two results:
ai-an10:59.2.2_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-an10:60.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:60.1.2_0: Now at that time Venerable Girimānanda was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
ai-an10:60.1.3_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:60.2.1_0: “Sir, Venerable Girimānanda is sick, suffering, gravely ill.
ai-an10:60.2.2_0: Sir, please go to Venerable Girimānanda out of compassion.”
ai-an10:60.2.3_0: “Ānanda, if you were to recite to the mendicant Girimānanda these ten perceptions, it’s possible that after hearing them his illness will die down on the spot.
ai-an10:60.3.2_0: The perceptions of impermanence, not-self, ugliness, drawbacks, giving up, fading away, cessation, dissatisfaction with the whole world, impermanence of all conditions, and mindfulness of breathing.
ai-an10:60.4.1_0: And what is the perception of impermanence?
ai-an10:60.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.4.3_0: ‘Form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are impermanent.’
ai-an10:60.4.4_0: And so they meditate observing impermanence in the five grasping aggregates.
ai-an10:60.4.5_0: This is called the perception of impermanence.
ai-an10:60.5.1_0: And what is the perception of not-self?
ai-an10:60.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.5.3_0: ‘The eye and sights, ear and sounds, nose and smells, tongue and tastes, body and touches, and mind and thoughts are not-self.’
ai-an10:60.5.4_0: And so they meditate observing not-self in the six interior and exterior sense fields.
ai-an10:60.5.5_0: This is called the perception of not-self.
ai-an10:60.6.1_0: And what is the perception of ugliness?
ai-an10:60.6.2_0: It’s when a mendicant examines their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-an10:60.6.3_0: ‘In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.’
ai-an10:60.6.4_0: And so they meditate observing ugliness in this body.
ai-an10:60.6.5_0: This is called the perception of ugliness.
ai-an10:60.7.1_0: And what is the perception of drawbacks?
ai-an10:60.7.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.7.3_0: ‘This body has much suffering and many drawbacks. That is:
ai-an10:60.7.4_0: Diseases of the eye, inner ear, nose, tongue, body, head, outer ear, mouth, teeth, and lips. Cough, asthma, catarrh, inflammation, fever, stomach ache, fainting, dysentery, gastric pain, cholera, leprosy, boils, eczema, tuberculosis, epilepsy, herpes, itch, scabs, smallpox, scabies, hemorrhage, diabetes, piles, pimples, and ulcers. Afflictions stemming from disorders of bile, phlegm, wind, or their conjunction. Afflictions caused by change in weather, by not taking care of yourself, by overexertion, or as the result of past
ai-an10:60.7.5_0: And so they meditate observing drawbacks in this body.
ai-an10:60.7.6_0: This is called the perception of drawbacks.
ai-an10:60.8.1_0: And what is the perception of giving up?
ai-an10:60.8.2_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t tolerate a sensual,
ai-an10:60.8.2_1: They don’t tolerate them, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.
ai-an10:60.8.2_2: They don’t tolerate any cruel, but give them up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.
ai-an10:60.8.2_3: They don’t tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.
ai-an10:60.8.3_0: This is called the perception of giving up.
ai-an10:60.9.1_0: And what is the perception of fading away?
ai-an10:60.9.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.9.3_0: ‘This is peaceful; this is sublime—that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, extinguishment.’
ai-an10:60.9.4_0: This is called the perception of fading away.
ai-an10:60.10.1_0: And what is the perception of cessation?
ai-an10:60.10.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.10.3_0: ‘This is peaceful; this is sublime—that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, cessation, extinguishment.’
ai-an10:60.10.4_0: This is called the perception of cessation.
ai-an10:60.11.1_0: And what is the perception of dissatisfaction with the whole world?
ai-an10:60.11.2_0: It’s when a mendicant lives giving up and not grasping on to the attraction and grasping to the world, the mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.
ai-an10:60.11.3_0: This is called the perception of dissatisfaction with the whole world.
ai-an10:60.12.1_0: And what is the perception of the impermanence of all conditions?
ai-an10:60.12.2_0: It’s when a mendicant is horrified, repelled, and disgusted with all conditions.
ai-an10:60.12.3_0: This is called the perception of the impermanence of all conditions.
ai-an10:60.13.1_0: And what is mindfulness of breathing?
ai-an10:60.13.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there. ...
ai-an10:60.13.3_0: Just mindful, they breath in. Mindful, they breath out.
ai-an10:60.13.4_0: When breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’
ai-an10:60.13.4_1: When breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’ When breathing out heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing out heavily.’
ai-an10:60.13.5_0: When breathing in lightly they know: ‘I’m breathing in lightly.’
ai-an10:60.13.5_1: When breathing in lightly they know: ‘I’m breathing in lightly.’
ai-an10:60.13.6_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the whole body. They practice breathing out experiencing the whole body.
ai-an10:60.13.7_0: They practice breathing in stilling the body’s motion.
ai-an10:60.13.7_1: They practice breathing out stilling the body’s motion.
ai-an10:60.13.8_0: They practice breathing in experiencing rapture. They practice breathing out experiencing rapture.
ai-an10:60.13.9_0: They practice breathing in experiencing bliss. They practice breathing out experiencing bliss.
ai-an10:60.13.10_0: They practice breathing in experiencing these emotions.
ai-an10:60.13.10_1: They practice breathing out experiencing these emotions.
ai-an10:60.13.11_0: They practice breathing in stilling these emotions.
ai-an10:60.13.11_1: They practice breathing out stilling these emotions.
ai-an10:60.13.12_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the mind. They practice breathing out experiencing the mind.
ai-an10:60.13.13_0: When breathing in, he trains in gladdening the mind; when breathing out, he trains in gladdening the mind.
ai-an10:60.13.14_0: They practice breathing in immersing the mind. They practice breathing out immersing the mind.
ai-an10:60.13.15_0: When breathing in, he trains in freeing the mind; when breathing out, he trains in freeing the mind.
ai-an10:60.13.16_0: They practice breathing in observing impermanence. They practice breathing out observing impermanence.
ai-an10:60.13.17_0: They practice breathing in observing fading away. They practice breathing out observing fading away.
ai-an10:60.13.18_0: They practice breathing in observing cessation. They practice breathing out observing cessation.
ai-an10:60.13.19_0: They practice breathing in observing letting go. They practice breathing out observing letting go.
ai-an10:60.13.20_0: This is called mindfulness of breathing.
ai-an10:60.14.1_0: If you were to recite to the mendicant Girimānanda these ten perceptions, it’s possible that after hearing them his illness will die down on the spot.”
ai-an10:60.15.1_0: Then Ānanda, having learned these ten perceptions from the Buddha himself, went to Girimānanda and recited them.
ai-an10:60.15.1_1: where they go to Venerable Ānanda.
ai-an10:60.15.2_0: Then after Girimānanda heard these ten perceptions his illness died down on the spot.
ai-an10:60.15.3_0: And that’s how he recovered from that illness.
ai-an10:60.15.3_1: And because Venerable Ānanda has given up illness.
ai-an10:60.15.5_0: The first sub-chapter on shaped is finished.
ai-an10:61.1.1_0: “Mendicants, it is said that no first point of ignorance is evident, before which there was no ignorance, and afterwards it came to be.
ai-an10:61.1.2_0: And yet it is evident that there is a specific condition for ignorance.
ai-an10:61.2.1_0: I say that ignorance is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.2_0: And what is the fuel for ignorance?
ai-an10:61.2.4_0: I say that the five hindrances are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.5_0: And what is the fuel for the five hindrances?
ai-an10:61.2.6_0: You should say: ‘The three kinds of misconduct.’
ai-an10:61.2.7_0: I say that bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.8_0: And what is the fuel for the three kinds of misconduct?
ai-an10:61.2.9_0: You should say: ‘The faculty of restraint.’
ai-an10:61.2.10_0: I say that the faculty of restraint is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.11_0: And what is the fuel for restraint of the faculty?
ai-an10:61.2.12_0: You should say: ‘Listening to have a true goal.’
ai-an10:61.2.13_0: I say that lack of fuel is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.14_0: And what is the fuel for lack of mindfulness and situational awareness?
ai-an10:61.2.16_0: I say that improper attention is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.17_0: And what is the fuel for improper attention?
ai-an10:61.2.19_0: I say that faith is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.20_0: And what is the fuel for lack of faith?
ai-an10:61.2.21_0: You should say: ‘Listening to an untrue teaching.’
ai-an10:61.2.22_0: I say that listening to an untrue teaching is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.2.23_0: And what is the fuel for listening to an untrue teaching?
ai-an10:61.2.24_0: You should say: ‘The true teaching with a good person.’
ai-an10:61.3.1_0: In this way, when the factor of associating with bad people is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to an untrue teaching. When the factor of listening to an untrue teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of lack of faith ... improper attention ... lack of mindfulness and situational awareness ... lack of sense restraint ...the three kinds of misconduct ... the five hindrances. When the five hindrances are fulfilled, they fulfill ignorance.
ai-an10:61.3.2_0: This is how a fuel then crosses over.
ai-an10:61.4.1_0: It’s like when the rain pours down on a mountain top, and the water flows downhill to fill the hollows, crevices, and creeks.
ai-an10:61.4.1_1: As they become full, they fill up the pools. The pools fill up the lakes, the lakes fill up the streams, and the streams fill up the rivers. And as the rivers become full, they fill up the ocean.
ai-an10:61.4.2_0: This is how the fuel then crosses over,
ai-an10:61.5.1_0: In the same way, when the factor of associating with bad people is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to an untrue teaching. When the factor of listening to an untrue teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of lack of faith ... improper attention ... lack of mindfulness and situational awareness ... lack of sense restraint ...the three kinds of misconduct ... the five hindrances. When the five hindrances are fulfilled, they fulfill ignorance.
ai-an10:61.5.2_0: This is how a fuel then crosses over.
ai-an10:61.6.1_0: The freedom of heart is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.2_0: And what is the fuel for knowledge and freedom?
ai-an10:61.6.3_0: You should say: ‘The seven awakening factors.’
ai-an10:61.6.4_0: I say that the seven awakening factors are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.5_0: And what is the fuel for the seven awakening factors?
ai-an10:61.6.6_0: You should say: ‘The four kinds of mindfulness meditation.’
ai-an10:61.6.7_0: I say that the four kinds of mindfulness meditation is fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.8_0: And what is the fuel for the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?

ai-an10:61.6.10_0: I say that the three kinds of good conduct is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.11_0: And what is the fuel for the three kinds of good conduct?
ai-an10:61.6.12_0: You should say: ‘The faculty of restraint.’
ai-an10:61.6.13_0: I say that sense restraint is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.14_0: And what is the fuel for sense restraint?
ai-an10:61.6.16_0: I say that mindfulness and situational awareness is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.17_0: And what is the fuel for mindfulness and situational awareness?
ai-an10:61.6.19_0: I say that proper attention is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.20_0: And what is the fuel for proper attention?
ai-an10:61.6.22_0: I say that faith is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.23_0: And what is the fuel for faith?
ai-an10:61.6.24_0: You should say: ‘Listening to an untrue teaching.’
ai-an10:61.6.25_0: I say that listening to an untrue teaching is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:61.6.26_0: And what is the fuel for listening to an untrue teaching?
ai-an10:61.7.1_0: In this way, when the factor of associating with good people is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to the true teaching. When the factor of listening to the true teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of faith ... proper attention ... mindfulness and situational awareness ... sense restraint ...the three kinds of good conduct ... the four kinds of mindfulness meditation ... the seven awakening factors. When the seven awakening factors are fulfilled, they fulfill knowledge and freedom.
ai-an10:61.7.2_0: That’s how a fuel is sustained by knowledge and freedom.
ai-an10:61.8.1_0: It’s like when it rains heavily on a mountain top, and the water flows downhill to fill the hollows, crevices, and creeks. As they become full, they fill up the pools. The pools fill up the lakes, the lakes fill up the streams, and the streams fill up the rivers. And as the rivers become full, they fill up the ocean.
ai-an10:61.8.2_0: This is how the fuel then crosses over,
ai-an10:61.9.1_0: In the same way, when the factor of associating with good people is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to the true teaching. When the seven awakening factors are fulfilled, they fulfill knowledge and freedom.
ai-an10:61.9.2_0: That’s how a fuel is sustained by knowledge and freedom.”
ai-an10:61.9.3_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-an10:62.1.1_0: “Mendicants, it is said that no first point of craving for continued existence is evident,
ai-an10:62.1.1_1: ‘Formerly there was no craving for continued existence, and afterwards it came to be.’
ai-an10:62.1.2_0: And yet it is evident that there is a specific condition for craving for continued existence.
ai-an10:62.2.1_0: I say that craving for continued existence is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:62.2.2_0: And what is the fuel for craving for continued existence?
ai-an10:62.2.4_0: I say that ignorance is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:62.2.5_0: And what is the fuel for ignorance?
ai-an10:62.2.7_0: I say that the five hindrances are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.
ai-an10:62.2.8_0: And what is the fuel for the five hindrances?
ai-an10:62.2.9_0: You should say: ‘The three kinds of misconduct.’
ai-an10:62.2.10_0: I say that bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:62.2.11_0: And what is the fuel for the three kinds of misconduct?
ai-an10:62.2.12_0: You should say: ‘The faculty of restraint.’
ai-an10:62.2.13_0: I say that the faculty of restraint is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

ai-an10:62.2.17_0: And what is the fuel for lack of mindfulness and situational awareness?

ai-an10:62.2.20_0: And what is the fuel for improper attention?
ai-an10:62.2.22_0: I say that faith is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:62.2.23_0: And what is the fuel for lack of faith?
ai-an10:62.2.24_0: You should say: ‘Listening to an untrue teaching.’
ai-an10:62.2.25_0: I say that listening to an untrue teaching is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.
ai-an10:62.2.26_0: And what is the fuel for listening to an untrue teaching?
ai-an10:62.2.27_0: You should say: ‘The true teaching with a good person.’
ai-an10:62.3.1_0: In this way, when the factor of associating with bad people is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to an untrue teaching. When the factor of listening to an untrue teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of lack of faith ... improper attention ... lack of mindfulness and situational awareness ... lack of sense restraint ...the three kinds of misconduct ... the five hindrances ... ignorance. When ignorance is fulfilled, it fulfills craving for continued existence.
ai-an10:62.3.2_0: This is how, this is how far shore.

When the factor of listening to an untrue teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of lack of faith ... improper attention ... lack of mindfulness and situational awareness ... lack of sense restraint ...the three kinds of misconduct ... the five hindrances ... ignorance. When ignorance is fulfilled, it fulfills craving for continued existence.

ai-an10:63.1.1_0: “Mendicants, all those who have come to a conclusion about me are accomplished in view.
ai-an10:63.1.2_0: Of those who are accomplished in view, five conclude their path in this realm, and five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.
ai-an10:63.1.4_0: They’re staying in the junctions, yet a single once-returner and non-returner. And they’re a perfected one.
ai-an10:63.1.5_0: These are the five conclude their path in this realm.
ai-an10:63.1.7_0: One extinguished between one life and the next, and the next.
ai-an10:63.1.8_0: Of these five conclude their path in this realm, I finished.
ai-an10:63.1.9_0: All those who have come to a conclusion about me are accomplished in view.
ai-an10:63.1.10_0: Of those who are accomplished in view, these five conclude their path in this realm, and these five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.”
ai-an10:64.1.1_0: “Mendicants, all those who have experiential confidence in me have entered the stream.
ai-an10:64.1.2_0: Of those who have entered the stream, five conclude their path in this realm, and five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.
ai-an10:64.1.4_0: They’re staying in the junctions, yet a single once-returner and non-returner. And they’re a perfected one.
ai-an10:64.1.5_0: These are the five conclude their path in this realm.
ai-an10:64.1.7_0: One extinguished between one life and the next, and the next.
ai-an10:64.1.8_0: Of these five conclude their path in this realm, I finished.
ai-an10:64.1.9_0: All those who have experiential confidence in me have entered the stream.
ai-an10:64.1.10_0: Of those who have entered the stream, these five conclude their path in this realm, and these five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.”
ai-an10:65.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans at the little village of Nālaka.
ai-an10:65.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-an10:65.1.3_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
ai-an10:65.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, what is happiness and what is suffering?”
ai-an10:65.2.2_0: “Rebirth is suffering, reverend, no rebirth is happiness.
ai-an10:65.2.3_0: When there is rebirth, you can expect this kind of suffering.
ai-an10:65.2.4_0: Cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, and urination. Contact with fire, clubs, and knives. And relatives and friends get together and annoy you.
ai-an10:65.2.5_0: When there is rebirth, this is the kind of suffering you can expect.
ai-an10:65.2.6_0: When there is no rebirth, you can expect this kind of happiness.
ai-an10:65.2.7_0: No cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, or urination. No contact with fire, clubs, or knives. And relatives and friends don’t get together and annoy you.
ai-an10:65.2.8_0: When there is no rebirth, this is the kind of happiness you can expect.”
ai-an10:66.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans at the little village of Nālaka.
ai-an10:66.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-an10:66.1.3_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
ai-an10:66.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, in this teaching and training, what is happiness and what is suffering?”
ai-an10:66.2.2_0: “Reverend, in this teaching and training dissatisfaction is suffering and satisfaction is happiness.
ai-an10:66.2.3_0: When you’re dissatisfied, you can expect this kind of suffering.
ai-an10:66.2.4_0: You don’t find happiness or pleasure while walking ...
ai-an10:66.2.6_0: and seated at the same time.
ai-an10:66.2.9_0: or wilderness, even for the wilderness.
ai-an10:66.2.10_0: or at the foot of a tree, too, have gone to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut.
ai-an10:66.2.14_0: When you’re dissatisfied, this is the kind of suffering you can expect.
ai-an10:66.3.1_0: When you’re satisfied, you can expect this kind of happiness.
ai-an10:66.3.2_0: You find happiness or pleasure while walking ...
ai-an10:66.3.4_0: and seated at the same time.
ai-an10:66.3.7_0: or wilderness, even for the wilderness.
ai-an10:66.3.8_0: or at the foot of a tree, too, have gone to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut.
ai-an10:66.3.12_0: When you’re satisfied, this is the kind of happiness you can expect.”
ai-an10:67.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Kosalans named Naḷakapāna.
ai-an10:67.1.2_0: There the Buddha stayed near Naḷakapāna in the parrot tree grove.
ai-an10:67.1.3_0: On one occasion on the observance day, he was seated surrounded by the Sangha of monks.
ai-an10:67.1.4_0: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk. Then he looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed Venerable Sāriputta:
ai-an10:67.2.1_0: “The Sangha of monks is without dullness and drowsiness.
ai-an10:67.2.2_0: Give them some Dhamma talk as you feel inspired.
ai-an10:67.3.1_0: And then he spread out his outer robe folded in four and laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.
ai-an10:67.4.1_0: “Reverends, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.4.4_0: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.4.5_0: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only decline.
ai-an10:67.4.6_0: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.4.9_0: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.5.1_0: A faithless individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.2_0: An individual with no conscience is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.3_0: A prudent individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.4_0: A lazy individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.5_0: A witless individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.6_0: An irritable individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.7_0: A hostile individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.8_0: An individual with few desires is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.9_0: An individual with bad friends is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.10_0: An individual with wrong view is in decline.
ai-an10:67.6.1_0: Whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.6.3_0: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.6.4_0: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only grow.
ai-an10:67.6.5_0: In the same way, whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.6.8_0: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.7.2_0: An individual with a conscience doesn’t decline.
ai-an10:67.7.8_0: An individual with few desires doesn’t decline.
ai-an10:67.7.9_0: An individual with good friends doesn’t decline.
ai-an10:67.7.10_0: An individual with right view doesn’t decline.”
ai-an10:67.8.1_0: Then the Buddha rose up and said to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-an10:67.8.3_0: Whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.8.6_0: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.8.7_0: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only decline.
ai-an10:67.8.8_0: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.8.9_0: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.9.1_0: A faithless individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.9.10_0: An individual with wrong view is in decline.
ai-an10:67.10.1_0: Whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.10.4_0: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.10.5_0: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only grow.
ai-an10:67.10.6_0: In the same way, whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.10.9_0: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.11.10_0: An individual with right view doesn’t decline.”

ai-an10:69.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:69.1.2_0: Now at that time, after the meal, on return from alms-round, several mendicants sat together in the assembly hall.
ai-an10:69.1.3_0: talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and countries; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; motley talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.
ai-an10:69.2.1_0: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to the assembly hall.
ai-an10:69.2.1_1: where he sat down on a prepared seat.
ai-an10:69.2.2_0: and told the mendicants what had happened.
ai-an10:69.2.3_0: “Mendicants, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”
ai-an10:69.3.1_0: And they told him what had happened.
ai-an10:69.3.2_0: talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and countries; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; motley talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.”
ai-an10:69.3.3_0: “Mendicants, it is not appropriate for you gentlemen who have gone forth in faith from the lay life to homelessness to engage in these kinds of unworthy talk.
ai-an10:69.3.4_0: talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and countries; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; motley talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.
ai-an10:69.4.1_0: There are ten topics of discussion.
ai-an10:69.4.3_0: Talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:69.4.4_0: These are the ten topics of discussion.
ai-an10:69.5.1_0: Mendicants, if you bring up these topics of conversation again and again then your glory could surpass even the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful, let alone the wanderers who follow other paths.”
ai-an10:70.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

ai-an10:70.2.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ten grounds for praise.
ai-an10:70.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant personally has few wishes, and speaks to the mendicants on having few wishes.
ai-an10:70.2.4_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.3.1_0: A mendicant personally is content, and speaks to the mendicants on contentment.
ai-an10:70.3.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.4.1_0: A mendicant personally is secluded, and speaks to the mendicants on seclusion.
ai-an10:70.4.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.5.1_0: A mendicant personally doesn’t mix closely with others, and speaks to the mendicants on not mixing closely with others.
ai-an10:70.5.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.6.1_0: A mendicant personally is energetic, and speaks to the mendicants on being energetic.
ai-an10:70.6.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.7.1_0: A mendicant personally is accomplished in ethics, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in ethics.
ai-an10:70.7.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.8.1_0: A mendicant personally is accomplished in immersion, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in immersion.
ai-an10:70.8.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.9.1_0: A mendicant personally is accomplished in wisdom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in wisdom.
ai-an10:70.9.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.10.1_0: A mendicant personally is accomplished in freedom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in freedom.
ai-an10:70.10.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.11.1_0: A mendicant personally is accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and speaks to the mendicants on being accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:70.11.2_0: This is a ground for praise.
ai-an10:70.12.1_0: These are the ten grounds for praise.”
ai-an10:70.12.3_0: The second sub-chapter on Yama is finished.
ai-an10:70.13.1_0: Craving, ignorance, the release of craving,
ai-an10:70.13.2_0: two kinds of happiness and two kinds of happiness—
ai-an10:71.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:71.2.1_0: “Mendicants, live by the ethical precepts and the monastic code. Live restrained in the code of conduct, conducting yourselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, keep the rules you’ve undertaken.
ai-an10:71.3.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I be liked and approved by my spiritual companions, respected and admired.’ So let them fulfill their precepts, be committed to inner serenity of the heart, not neglect absorption, be endowed with discernment, and frequent empty huts.
ai-an10:71.4.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.’ So let them fulfill their precepts, be committed to inner serenity of the heart, not neglect absorption, be endowed with discernment, and frequent empty huts.
ai-an10:71.5.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I use robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.’ So let them fulfill their precepts ...
ai-an10:71.5.1_1: that empty huts are empty of empty huts.
ai-an10:71.6.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘When deceased family and relatives who have passed away recollect me with a confident mind, may this be very fruitful and beneficial for them.’ So let them fulfill their precepts ...
ai-an10:71.6.1_1: that empty huts are empty of empty huts.
ai-an10:71.7.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I be content with any kind of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.’ So let them fulfill their precepts ...
ai-an10:71.7.1_1: that empty huts are empty of empty huts.
ai-an10:71.8.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I endure cold, heat, hunger, and thirst. May I endure the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles. May I endure rude and unwelcome criticism. And may I put up with physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, and life-threatening.’ So let them fulfill their precepts ...
ai-an10:71.8.1_1: that empty huts are empty of empty huts.
ai-an10:71.9.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I prevail over desire and discontent, and may desire and discontent not prevail over me. May I live having mastered desire and discontent whenever they have arisen.’ So let them fulfill their precepts ...
ai-an10:71.9.1_1: that empty huts are empty of empty huts.
ai-an10:71.10.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I prevail over fear and dread, and may fear and dread not prevail over me. May I live having mastered fear and dread whenever they arise.’ So let them fulfill their precepts ...
ai-an10:71.10.1_1: that empty huts are empty of empty huts.
ai-an10:71.11.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when I want, without trouble or difficulty.’ So let them fulfill their precepts ...
ai-an10:71.11.1_1: that empty huts are empty of empty huts.
ai-an10:71.12.1_0: A mendicant might wish: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’ So let them fulfill their precepts, be committed to inner serenity of the heart, not neglect absorption, be endowed with discernment, and frequent empty huts.
ai-an10:71.13.1_0: ‘Live by the ethical precepts and the monastic code. Live restrained in the code of conduct, conducting yourselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, keep the rules you’ve undertaken.’
ai-an10:71.13.2_0: That’s what I said, and this is why he said it.”
ai-an10:71.13.3_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-an10:72.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof, together with several well-known senior disciples.
ai-an10:72.1.2_0: They included Venerables Cāla, Upacāla, Kakkaṭa, Kaṭimbha, Kaṭa, Kaṭissaṅga,
ai-an10:72.2.1_0: Now at that time several well-known Licchavis plunged deep into the Great Wood to see the Buddha. Driving a succession of fine carriages, they made a dreadful racket.
ai-an10:72.2.3_0: “These several well-known Licchavis have plunged deep into the Great Wood to see the Buddha. Driving a succession of fine carriages, they’re making a dreadful racket.
ai-an10:72.2.4_0: But the Buddha has said that sound is a thorn to absorption.
ai-an10:72.2.5_0: Let’s go to the Gosiṅga Sal Wood.
ai-an10:72.2.6_0: There we can meditate comfortably, free of noise and crowds.”
ai-an10:72.2.7_0: Then those venerables went to the Gosiṅga Sal Wood,
ai-an10:72.2.8_0: where they meditated comfortably, free of noise and crowds.
ai-an10:72.3.1_0: The Buddha said to the mendicants,
ai-an10:72.3.2_0: “Mendicants, where are Cāla, Upacāla, Kakkaṭa, Kaṭimbha, Kaṭa, and Kaṭissaṅga?
ai-an10:72.3.3_0: How have you come to your disciples?”
ai-an10:72.4.1_0: And the mendicants told him what had happened.
ai-an10:72.4.2_0: ‘These several well-known Licchavis have plunged deep into the Great Wood to see the Buddha. Why don’t we set up a succession of fine carriages, the Buddha? Why don’t we set out to see him, the Dhanañjāni at the foot of the time of the Buddha?’
ai-an10:72.4.3_0: Then those venerables went to the Gosiṅga Sal Wood,
ai-an10:72.4.4_0: That’s where they meditated comfortably, free of noise and crowds.”
ai-an10:72.5.1_0: “Good, good, mendicants! It’s just as those great disciples have so rightly explained. I have said that sound is a thorn to absorption.
ai-an10:72.6.1_0: Mendicants, there are these ten thorns.
ai-an10:72.6.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:72.6.3_0: Relishing company is a thorn for someone who loves seclusion. Focusing on the beautiful feature of things is a thorn for someone pursuing the meditation on ugliness. Seeing shows is a thorn to someone restraining the senses. Lingering in the neighborhood of females is a thorn to celibacy. Sound is a thorn to the first absorption. Placing the mind and keeping it connected are a thorn to the second absorption. Rapture is a thorn to the third absorption. Breathing is a thorn to the fourth absorption. Perception and feeling are a thorn to the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling. Greed, hate, and delusion are thorns.
ai-an10:72.7.3_0: Mendicants, live free of thorns and rid of thorns!
ai-an10:72.7.4_0: The perfected ones live free of thorns,
ai-an10:73.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these ten likable, desirable, and agreeable things are rare in the world.
ai-an10:73.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:73.1.4_0: the beautiful ones, hard to find in the world,
ai-an10:73.1.5_0: the health, and in world is hard to get,
ai-an10:73.2.1_0: Ten things hinder the ten likable, desirable, and agreeable things that are rare in the world.
ai-an10:73.2.2_0: Sloth and lack of initiative hinder wealth. Lack of adornment and decoration hinder beauty. Unsuitable activity hinders health. Bad friendship hinders ethical conduct. Lack of sense restraint hinders the spiritual life. Dishonesty hinders friends. Not reciting hinders learning. Not wanting to listen and ask questions hinders wisdom. Lack of commitment and reviewing hinder good qualities. Wrong practice hinders heaven.
ai-an10:73.2.3_0: These ten things hinder the ten likable, desirable, and agreeable things that are rare in the world.
ai-an10:73.3.1_0: Ten things nourish the ten likable, desirable, and agreeable things that are rare in the world.
ai-an10:73.3.2_0: Application and initiative nourish wealth. Adornment and decoration nourish beauty. Suitable activity nourishes health. Good friendship nourishes ethical conduct. Sense restraint nourishes the spiritual life. Honesty nourishes friends. Reciting nourishes learning. Eagerness to listen and ask questions nourishes wisdom. Commitment and reviewing nourish good qualities. Right practice nourishes heaven.
ai-an10:73.3.3_0: These ten things nourish the ten likable, desirable, and agreeable things that are rare in the world.”
ai-an10:74.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a noble disciple who grows in ten ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
ai-an10:74.1.3_0: He grows in fields and lands, money and grain, wives and children, in bondservants, workers, and staff, and in livestock. And he grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
ai-an10:74.1.4_0: A noble disciple who grows in ten ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
ai-an10:74.2.1_0: Someone who grows in money and grain,
ai-an10:74.2.4_0: by relatives and friends, and even by royals.
ai-an10:74.3.1_0: When someone grows in faith and ethics,
ai-an10:74.3.4_0: and in the present life he grows in both ways.”
ai-an10:75.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:75.1.2_0: Then Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of Migasālā.
ai-an10:75.1.2_1: where he sat down on a prepared seat.
ai-an10:75.1.3_0: Then the laywoman Migasālā went up to Ānanda,
ai-an10:75.1.3_2: Then the laywoman Migasālā said to Ānanda,
ai-an10:75.2.1_0: “Sir, Ānanda, how on earth are we supposed to understand the teaching taught by the Buddha, when the chaste and the unchaste are both reborn in exactly the same place in the next life?
ai-an10:75.2.2_0: My father Purāṇa was celibate, set apart, avoiding the common practice of sex.
ai-an10:75.2.3_0: When he passed away the Buddha declared that he was a once-returner, who was reborn in the company of the Joyful Gods.
ai-an10:75.2.4_0: But my uncle Isidatta was not celibate; he lived content with his wife.
ai-an10:75.2.5_0: When he passed away the Buddha declared that he was also a once-returner, who was reborn in the company of the Joyful Gods.
ai-an10:75.3.1_0: How on, Ānanda, how on earth are we supposed to understand the teaching taught by the Buddha, when the chaste and the unchaste are both reborn in exactly the same place in the next life?”
ai-an10:75.4.1_0: Then Ānanda, after taking alms-food in Migajāla’s home, got up from his seat and left.
ai-an10:75.4.2_0: Then after the meal, on his return from alms-round, Venerable Ānanda went to the Buddha.
ai-an10:75.5.1_0: “Sir, once I robed up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, went to the home of the laywoman Migasālā, and
ai-an10:75.5.1_1: where he sat down on a prepared seat.
ai-an10:75.5.2_0: and the laywoman Migasālā came to me.
ai-an10:75.5.2_2: Then the laywoman Migasālā said to me:
ai-an10:75.6.1_0: ‘Sir, Ānanda, how on earth are we supposed to understand the teaching taught by the Buddha, when the chaste and the unchaste are both reborn in exactly the same place in the next life?
ai-an10:75.6.2_0: My father Purāṇa was celibate, set apart, avoiding the common practice of sex.
ai-an10:75.6.3_0: When he passed away the Buddha declared that he was a once-returner, who was reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.
ai-an10:75.6.4_0: But my uncle Isidatta was not celibate; he lived content with his wife.
ai-an10:75.6.5_0: When he passed away the Buddha declared that he was also a once-returner, who was reborn in the company of the Joyful Gods.
ai-an10:75.7.1_0: How on, Ānanda, how on earth are we supposed to understand the teaching taught by the Buddha, when the chaste and the unchaste are both reborn in exactly the same place in the next life?’
ai-an10:75.7.2_0: When she said this, I said to her,
ai-an10:75.7.3_0: ‘Sister, this is how the Buddha has declared it.’”
ai-an10:75.8.1_0: “Ānanda, who is this laywoman Migasālā, a foolish incompetent matron, with a matron’s wit? And who is it that knows how to assess individuals?
ai-an10:75.9.1_0: These ten people are found in the world.
ai-an10:75.9.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:75.9.3_0: Take a certain person who is unethical.
ai-an10:75.9.4_0: And they don’t truly understand the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where that unethical conduct ceases without anything left over.
ai-an10:75.9.5_0: But they’ve not listened and learned and comprehended theoretically or found temporary freedom.
ai-an10:75.9.6_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re scrutinizing, not distinction.
ai-an10:75.9.7_0: They don’t return to a higher place, not distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-an10:75.10.1_0: Take a certain person who is unethical.
ai-an10:75.10.2_0: but truly understands the freedom of heart ...
ai-an10:75.10.3_0: But they’ve listened and learned and comprehended theoretically and found temporary freedom.
ai-an10:75.10.4_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the next life, not forward.
ai-an10:75.10.5_0: they are going to the higher place, not a lower.
ai-an10:75.11.2_0: ‘This one has just the same qualities as the other, so why is one worse and one better?’
ai-an10:75.11.3_0: That is for their lasting harm and suffering.
ai-an10:75.12.1_0: In this case, the person who is unethical,
ai-an10:75.12.2_0: but truly understands the freedom of heart ...
ai-an10:75.12.3_0: But they’ve listened and learned and comprehended theoretically and found temporary freedom.
ai-an10:75.12.6_0: Because the stream of the teaching carries them along.
ai-an10:75.12.7_0: But who knows the difference between them except a Realized One?
ai-an10:75.12.8_0: So, Ānanda, don’t be judgmental about people.
ai-an10:75.12.9_0: Don’t count the belongings of an individual.
ai-an10:75.12.10_0: Because he strikes a stand ford, Ānanda.
ai-an10:75.12.11_0: I should be refuded for good people, in a stand, or someone else.
