ai-an10:75.22.4_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re scrutinizing, not distinction.
ai-an10:75.22.5_0: They don’t return to a higher place, not distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-an10:75.23.1_0: Take a certain person who is restless.
ai-an10:75.23.2_0: But they truly understand the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where that restlessness ceases without anything left over.
ai-an10:75.23.3_0: But they’ve listened and learned and comprehended theoretically and found temporary freedom.
ai-an10:75.23.4_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the next life, not forward.
ai-an10:75.23.5_0: they are going to the higher place, not a lower.
ai-an10:75.24.2_0: ‘This one has just the same qualities as the other, so why is one worse and one better?’
ai-an10:75.24.3_0: That is for their lasting harm and suffering.
ai-an10:75.25.1_0: In this case the person who is restless, but truly understands the freedom of heart ...
ai-an10:75.25.2_0: But they’ve listened and learned and comprehended theoretically and found temporary freedom.
ai-an10:75.25.5_0: Because the stream of the teaching carries them along.
ai-an10:75.25.6_0: But who knows the difference between them except a Realized One?
ai-an10:75.25.7_0: So, Ānanda, don’t be judgmental about people.
ai-an10:75.25.8_0: Don’t count the belongings of an individual.
ai-an10:75.25.9_0: Because he strikes a stand ford, Ānanda.
ai-an10:75.25.10_0: I should be refuded for good people, in a stand, or someone else.
ai-an10:75.26.1_0: Who is this laywoman Migasālā, a foolish incompetent matron, with a matron’s wit? And who is it that knows how to assess individuals?
ai-an10:75.26.2_0: These ten people are found in the world.
ai-an10:75.27.1_0: If Isidatta had achieved Purāṇa’s level of ethical conduct, Purāṇa could not have even known Isidatta’s destination.
ai-an10:75.27.2_0: And if Purāṇa had achieved Isidatta’s level of wisdom, Isidatta could not have even known Purāṇa’s destination.
ai-an10:75.27.3_0: So, Ānanda, these two people are taken together.”
ai-an10:76.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if three things were not found, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha would not arise in the world, and the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One would not shine in the world.
ai-an10:76.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.1.4_0: If these three things were not found, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha would not arise in the world, and the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One would not shine in the world.
ai-an10:76.1.5_0: But since these three things are found, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arises in the world, and the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One shines in the world.
ai-an10:76.2.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up rebirth, old age, and death.
ai-an10:76.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.2.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up rebirth, old age, and death.
ai-an10:76.3.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an10:76.3.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.3.3_0: Identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.3.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an10:76.4.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.4.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.4.3_0: Improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.4.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.5.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.5.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.5.3_0: Unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.5.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.6.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.6.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.6.3_0: Not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.6.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.7.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.7.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.7.3_0: Restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.7.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.8.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.8.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.8.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.9.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
ai-an10:76.9.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.9.3_0: Disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.9.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
ai-an10:76.10.1_0: Without giving up three things you can’t give up disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.10.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.10.3_0: Lack of conscience, imprudence, and negligence.
ai-an10:76.10.4_0: Without giving up these three things you can’t give up disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.11.1_0: Mendicants, someone who lacks conscience and prudence is negligent.
ai-an10:76.11.2_0: When you’re negligent you can’t give up disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.11.3_0: When you’ve got bad friends you can’t give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
ai-an10:76.11.4_0: When you’re lazy you can’t give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.11.5_0: When you’re unethical you can’t give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.11.6_0: When you’ve got a fault-finding mind you can’t give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.11.7_0: When your mind is scattered you can’t give up improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.11.8_0: When your mind is sluggish you can’t give up identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.11.9_0: When you have doubts you can’t give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an10:76.11.10_0: Without giving up greed, hate, and delusion you can’t give up rebirth, old age, and death.
ai-an10:76.12.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up rebirth, old age, and death.
ai-an10:76.12.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.12.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up rebirth, old age, and death.
ai-an10:76.13.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an10:76.13.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.13.3_0: Identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.13.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an10:76.14.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.14.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.14.3_0: Improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.14.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.15.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.15.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.15.3_0: Unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.15.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.16.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.16.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.16.3_0: Not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.16.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.17.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.17.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.17.3_0: Restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.17.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.18.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.18.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.18.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.19.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
ai-an10:76.19.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.19.3_0: Disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.19.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
ai-an10:76.20.1_0: After giving up three things you can give up disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.20.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by three?
ai-an10:76.20.3_0: Lack of conscience, imprudence, and negligence.
ai-an10:76.20.4_0: After giving up these three things you can give up disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.21.1_0: Mendicants, someone who has conscience and prudence is diligent.
ai-an10:76.21.2_0: When you’re diligent you can give up disregard, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
ai-an10:76.21.3_0: When you’ve got good friends you can give up faithlessness, uncharitableness, and laziness.
ai-an10:76.21.4_0: When you’re energetic you can give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
ai-an10:76.21.5_0: When you’re ethical you can give up not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
ai-an10:76.21.6_0: When you don’t have a fault-finding mind you can give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a distracted mind.
ai-an10:76.21.7_0: When your mind isn’t scattered you can give up improper attention, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
ai-an10:76.21.8_0: When your mind isn’t sluggish you can give up identity view, doubt, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.
ai-an10:76.21.9_0: When you have no doubts you can give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-an10:76.21.10_0: After giving up greed, hate, and delusion you can give up rebirth, old age, and death.”
ai-an10:77.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a crow has ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:77.1.3_0: one who supports another, a plough, afflic, a greedy, a hater, delusional, and aport assist; and a weaker in training.
ai-an10:77.1.4_0: A crow has these ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:77.1.5_0: In the same way, a bad mendicant has these ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:77.1.7_0: one who supports another, a plough, afflic, a greedy, a hater, delusional, and aport assist; and a weaker in training.
ai-an10:77.1.8_0: A bad mendicant has these ten bad qualities.”
ai-an10:78.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the Jain ascetics have ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:78.1.8_0: They glorify themselves and put others down.
ai-an10:78.1.9_0: They’re attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go.
ai-an10:78.1.13_0: Jain ascetics have these ten bad qualities.”
ai-an10:79.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ten grounds for resentment.
ai-an10:79.1.3_0: Thinking: ‘They did wrong to me,’ you harbor resentment.
ai-an10:79.1.4_0: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong to me’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.6_0: ‘They did wrong to someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.7_0: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.8_0: ‘They will do wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.10_0: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.11_0: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike,’ you harbor resentment.
ai-an10:79.1.12_0: You get angry for no reason.
ai-an10:79.1.13_0: These are the ten grounds for resentment.”
ai-an10:80.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these ten methods to get rid of resentment.
ai-an10:80.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:80.1.3_0: Thinking: ‘They harmed me, but what can I possibly do?’ you get rid of resentment.
ai-an10:80.1.6_0: ‘They did wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:80.1.8_0: ‘They will harm someone I love ...’ ... They helped someone I dislike ...’ ...
ai-an10:80.1.10_0: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike, but what can I possibly do?’ you get rid of resentment.
ai-an10:80.1.11_0: And you don’t get angry for no reason.
ai-an10:80.1.12_0: These are the ten ways of getting rid of resentment.”
ai-an10:80.1.14_0: The third sub-chapter on respectfully is finished.
ai-an10:80.2.1_0: One who has acted like this,
ai-an10:80.2.3_0: And three are liars and three,
ai-an10:81.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā lotus pond.
ai-an10:81.1.2_0: Then Venerable Bāhuna went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:81.1.3_0: “Sir, how many things has the Realized One escaped from, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits?”
ai-an10:81.2.1_0: “Bāhuna, the Realized One has escaped from ten things, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.
ai-an10:81.2.3_0: The Realized One has escaped from form, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.
ai-an10:81.2.13_0: Suppose there was a blue water lily, or a pink or white lotus. Though it sprouted and grew in the water, it would rise up above the water and stand with no water clinging to it.
ai-an10:81.2.14_0: In the same way, the Realized One has escaped from ten things, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.”
ai-an10:81.2.15_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-an10:82.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:82.1.1_2: Sitting to one side, the Buddha said to Ānanda:
ai-an10:82.2.1_0: “Ānanda, it’s not possible for a faithless mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.3.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant who is unethical ...
ai-an10:82.11.1_0: of wrong view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.12.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.13.1_0: It is possible for a faithful mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.14.1_0: It is possible for a mendicant who is ethical ...
ai-an10:82.22.1_0: of right view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.23.1_0: It is possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
ai-an10:83.1.1_0: Then Venerable Puṇṇa went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:83.1.1_2: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha,
ai-an10:83.1.2_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes the Realized One feels inspired to teach, and other times not?”
ai-an10:83.2.1_0: “Puṇṇiya, when a mendicant has faith but doesn’t approach, the Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.2.2_0: But when a mendicant has faith and approaches, the Realized One feels inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.3.1_0: When a mendicant has faith and approaches, but doesn’t pay homage ...
ai-an10:83.3.3_0: they don’t lend an ear to the teaching ...
ai-an10:83.3.4_0: they don’t lend an ear to the teaching ...
ai-an10:83.3.5_0: they don’t remember the teachings they’ve remembered. ...
ai-an10:83.3.6_0: they reflect on the meaning of the teachings they’ve remembered, but, having understood the meaning and the teaching, they don’t practice accordingly ...
ai-an10:83.3.7_0: they practice accordingly, but they’re not a good speaker. Their voice is not polished, clear, articulate, and doesn’t express the meaning ...
ai-an10:83.3.8_0: They’re a good speaker, but they don’t educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire their spiritual companions. The Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.4.1_0: But when a mendicant has faith, approaches, pays homage, asks questions, lends an ear, remembers the teachings, reflects on the meaning, practices accordingly, has a good voice, and encourages their spiritual companions,
ai-an10:83.4.2_0: the Realized One feels inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.4.3_0: When someone has these ten qualities, the Realized One feels totally inspired to teach.”
ai-an10:84.1.1_0: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the mendicants,
ai-an10:84.2.1_0: “Reverend, take a mendicant who declares enlightenment:
ai-an10:84.2.2_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-an10:84.2.3_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples ...
ai-an10:84.2.4_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples. When pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, they fall into ruin and disaster because of such a cord.
ai-an10:84.3.1_0: They focus their mind on the Realized One, or his disciple.
ai-an10:84.3.2_0: ‘Why does this venerable declare enlightenment, saying,
ai-an10:84.3.3_0: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”?’
ai-an10:84.5.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of anger.
ai-an10:84.5.3_0: But being full of anger means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:84.6.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of ill will.
ai-an10:84.6.3_0: But being full of hostility towards the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:84.7.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of flies.
ai-an10:84.9.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of jealousy.
ai-an10:84.9.3_0: But being full of jealousy means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:84.10.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of compassion.
ai-an10:84.10.3_0: But being full of stinginess means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:84.11.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of desire.
ai-an10:84.12.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of anger.
ai-an10:84.12.3_0: But being full of deceitfulness means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:84.13.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of desire.
ai-an10:84.13.3_0: But being full of desire means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:84.14.1_0: But when this venerable stops half-way after achieving some insignificant distinction.
ai-an10:84.14.2_0: Stopping half-way means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.’
ai-an10:84.15.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant who gives up these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:84.15.2_0: It is possible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
ai-an10:85.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the land of the Cetis at Sahajāti.
ai-an10:85.1.2_0: There Venerable Mahācunda addressed the mendicants,
ai-an10:85.2.1_0: “Take a mendicant who boasts and brags about their achievements:
ai-an10:85.2.2_0: ‘I enter and emerge from the first absorption ... and the cessation of perception and feeling.’
ai-an10:85.3.1_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples ...
ai-an10:85.3.2_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples. When pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, they fall into ruin and disaster because of such a cord.
ai-an10:85.4.1_0: They focus their mind on the Realized One, or his disciple.
ai-an10:85.4.2_0: ‘Why does this venerable overestimate themselves and brags about their achievements?’
ai-an10:85.4.3_0: “I enter and emerge from the first absorption ...
ai-an10:85.4.4_0: and enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.’
ai-an10:85.6.1_0: ‘For a long time this venerable’s deeds have been broken, tainted, spotty, and marred. Their deeds and behavior are inconsistent.
ai-an10:85.7.2_0: and lack of faith means decline ...
ai-an10:85.8.2_0: and lack of learning means decline ...
ai-an10:85.9.2_0: and being hard to admonish means decline ...
ai-an10:85.16.1_0: Suppose one friend was to say to another:
ai-an10:85.16.2_0: ‘My dear friend, when you need money for some payment, just ask me and I’ll give it.’
ai-an10:85.16.3_0: Then when some payment falls due, that friend says to their friend:
ai-an10:85.16.3_1: ‘I need some money, my dear friend.
ai-an10:85.16.5_0: ‘Well then, my dear friend, dig here.’ So they dig there, but don’t find anything.
ai-an10:85.16.7_0: ‘You lied to me, my dear friend, you spoke hollow words when you told me to dig here.’
ai-an10:85.16.9_0: ‘I’m not put down, my dear friend, you speak hollow of this thing here.’
ai-an10:85.16.10_0: But they’d stop making a boat.
ai-an10:85.16.12_0: ‘You lied to me, my dear friend, you spoke hollow words when you told me to dig here.’
ai-an10:85.16.14_0: ‘I’m not put down, my dear friend, you speak hollow of this thing here.’
ai-an10:85.16.15_0: But they’d stop making a boat.
ai-an10:85.16.17_0: ‘You lied to me, my dear friend, you spoke hollow words when you told me to dig here.’
ai-an10:85.16.19_0: ‘I didn’t speak of you; I’m not empty.
ai-an10:85.16.19_1: But I had gone mad, I was out of my mind.’
ai-an10:85.17.1_0: In the same way, take a mendicant who boasts and brags about their achievements:
ai-an10:85.17.2_0: ‘I enter and emerge from the first absorption ... and the cessation of perception and feeling.’
ai-an10:85.18.1_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples ...
ai-an10:85.18.2_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples. When pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, they fall into ruin and disaster because of such a cord.
ai-an10:85.19.1_0: They focus their mind on the Realized One, or his disciple.
ai-an10:85.19.2_0: ‘Why does this venerable overestimate themselves and brags about their achievements?’
ai-an10:85.19.3_0: “I enter and emerge from the first absorption ...
ai-an10:85.19.4_0: and enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.’
ai-an10:85.21.1_0: ‘For a long time this venerable’s deeds have been broken, tainted, spotty, and marred. Their deeds and behavior are inconsistent.
ai-an10:85.22.2_0: and lack of faith means decline ...
ai-an10:85.23.2_0: and lack of learning means decline ...
ai-an10:85.24.2_0: and being hard to admonish means decline ...
ai-an10:85.31.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant who gives up these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:85.31.2_0: It is possible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
ai-an10:86.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Mahākassapa was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-an10:86.1.2_0: There Venerable Mahākassapa addressed the mendicants,
ai-an10:86.2.1_0: “Reverend, take a mendicant who declares enlightenment:
ai-an10:86.2.2_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-an10:86.2.3_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples ...
ai-an10:86.2.4_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples. When pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, they fall into ruin and disaster because of such a cord.
ai-an10:86.3.1_0: They focus their mind on the Realized One, or his disciple.
ai-an10:86.3.2_0: ‘Why does this venerable declare enlightenment, saying,
ai-an10:86.3.3_0: I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-an10:86.5.1_0: ‘This venerable overestimates themselves and takes that to be the truth. They perceive that they’ve attained what they haven’t attained, done what they haven’t done, and achieved what they haven’t achieved.
ai-an10:86.5.2_0: And why do they declare enlightenment out of overestimation:
ai-an10:86.5.3_0: I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-an10:86.6.1_0: They focus their mind on the Realized One, or his disciple.
ai-an10:86.6.2_0: ‘Why does this venerable overestimate themselves and take that to be the truth? Why do they perceive that they’ve attained what they haven’t attained, done what they haven’t done, and achieved what they haven’t achieved?
ai-an10:86.6.3_0: And why do they declare enlightenment out of overestimation:
ai-an10:86.6.4_0: I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-an10:86.8.1_0: ‘This venerable is very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reinforcing them by recitation, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically.
ai-an10:86.8.2_0: That’s why this venerable overestimates themselves and takes that to be the truth. They perceive that they’ve attained what they haven’t attained, done what they haven’t done, and achieved what they haven’t achieved.
ai-an10:86.8.3_0: And why do they declare enlightenment out of overestimation:
ai-an10:86.8.4_0: I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-an10:86.10.2_0: and often lives with a heart full covetousness.
ai-an10:86.10.3_0: Being full of covetousness means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:86.11.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of ill will.
ai-an10:86.11.3_0: But being full of ill will means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:86.12.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of dullness and drowsiness.
ai-an10:86.12.3_0: But being full of dullness and drowsiness means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.
ai-an10:86.13.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of restlessness.
ai-an10:86.14.2_0: and often lives with a heart full of doubt.
ai-an10:86.15.1_0: This venerable relishes work. They love it and like to relish it ...
ai-an10:86.17.2_0: and lack of learning means decline ...
ai-an10:86.18.1_0: This venerable enjoys company and groups.
ai-an10:86.19.1_0: But when this venerable stops half-way after achieving some insignificant distinction.
ai-an10:86.19.2_0: Stopping half-way means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.’
ai-an10:86.20.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant who gives up these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:86.20.2_0: It is possible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
ai-an10:87.1.1_0: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants concerning the mendicant Kalandaka:
ai-an10:87.2.1_0: “Firstly, a mendicant raises disciplinary issues and doesn’t praise the settlement of disciplinary issues.
ai-an10:87.2.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant doesn’t want to train, and doesn’t praise taking up the training. ...
ai-an10:87.3.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has bad desires, and doesn’t praise getting rid of desires. ...
ai-an10:87.4.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is irritable, and doesn’t praise getting rid of anger. ...
ai-an10:87.5.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.6.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant denigrates others, and doesn’t praise getting rid of denigration. ...
ai-an10:87.6.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.7.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is devious, and doesn’t praise getting rid of deviousness. ...
ai-an10:87.7.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.8.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is deceitful, and doesn’t praise getting rid of deceitfulness. ...
ai-an10:87.8.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.9.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant doesn’t pay attention to the teachings, and doesn’t praise attending to the teachings. ...
ai-an10:87.9.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.10.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is not in retreat, and doesn’t praise retreat. ...
ai-an10:87.10.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.11.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is inhospitable to their spiritual companions, and doesn’t praise hospitality.
ai-an10:87.11.2_0: This quality doesn’t conduce to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.12.1_0: Even though a mendicant such as this might wish:
ai-an10:87.12.2_0: ‘If only they honor, respect, revere, or venerate me, their spiritual companions wouldn’t honor, respect, revere, or venerate me alone with my spiritual companions!’
ai-an10:87.12.4_0: Because their sensible spiritual companions see that they’ve not given up those bad unskillful qualities.
ai-an10:87.13.2_0: ‘If only the humans would put me in a thoroughbred’s place, feed me a thoroughbred’s food, and give me a thoroughbred’s grooming.’ Still the humans wouldn’t put them in a thoroughbred’s place, feed them a thoroughbred’s food, or give them a thoroughbred’s grooming.
ai-an10:87.13.4_0: Because sensible humans see that they haven’t given up their tricks, bluffs, ruses, and feints.
ai-an10:87.13.5_0: In the same way, even though a mendicant such as this might wish:
ai-an10:87.13.6_0: ‘If only they honor, respect, revere, or venerate me, their spiritual companions wouldn’t honor, respect, revere, or venerate me alone with my spiritual companions!’
ai-an10:87.13.8_0: Because their sensible spiritual companions see that they’ve not given up those bad unskillful qualities.
ai-an10:87.14.1_0: Next, a mendicant doesn’t raise disciplinary issues and praises the settlement of disciplinary issues.
ai-an10:87.14.2_0: This quality conduces to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.15.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant wants to train, and praises taking up the training. ...
ai-an10:87.15.2_0: This quality conduces to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.16.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has few desires, and praises getting rid of desires. ...
ai-an10:87.16.2_1: to develop one that leads to developed.
ai-an10:87.17.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is not irritable, and praises getting rid of anger. ...
ai-an10:87.17.2_1: to develop one that leads to developed.
ai-an10:87.18.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant doesn’t denigrate others, and praises getting rid of denigration. ...
ai-an10:87.18.2_0: This quality praises those who don’t denigrate others,
ai-an10:87.18.2_1: to develop one that leads to developed.
ai-an10:87.19.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t devious, and praises getting rid of deviousness. ...
ai-an10:87.19.2_0: This is a quality that doesn’t praise ...
ai-an10:87.19.2_1: to develop one that leads to developed.
ai-an10:87.20.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t deceitful, and praises getting rid of deceitfulness. ...
ai-an10:87.20.2_1: to develop one that leads to developed.
ai-an10:87.21.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant pays attention to the teachings, and praises attending to the teachings. ...
ai-an10:87.21.2_0: When a mendicant does pay attention to the teachings, this too is one thing ...
ai-an10:87.21.2_1: to develop one that leads to developed.
ai-an10:87.22.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is in retreat, and praises retreat. ...
ai-an10:87.22.2_1: to develop one that leads to developed.
ai-an10:87.23.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is hospitable to their spiritual companions, and praises hospitality.
ai-an10:87.23.2_0: This quality conduces to warmth, respect, esteem, harmony, and unity.
ai-an10:87.24.1_0: Even though a mendicant such as this might never wish:
ai-an10:87.24.2_0: ‘If only they honor, respect, revere, and venerate me alone with my spiritual companions!’ Then they might honor, respect, revere, and venerate me.
ai-an10:87.24.4_0: Because their sensible spiritual companions see that they’ve given up those bad unskillful qualities.
ai-an10:87.25.1_0: Suppose a fine thoroughbred never wished:
ai-an10:87.25.2_0: ‘If only the humans would put me in a thoroughbred’s place, feed me a thoroughbred’s food, and give me a thoroughbred’s grooming.’ Still the humans would put them in a thoroughbred’s place, feed them a thoroughbred’s food, and give them a thoroughbred’s grooming.
ai-an10:87.25.4_0: Because sensible humans see that they’ve given up their tricks, bluffs, ruses, and feints.
ai-an10:87.26.1_0: In the same way, even though a mendicant such as this might never wish:
ai-an10:87.26.2_0: ‘If only they honor, respect, revere, and venerate me alone with my spiritual companions!’ Then they might honor, respect, revere, and venerate me.
ai-an10:87.26.4_0: Because their sensible spiritual companions see that they’ve given up those bad unskillful qualities.”
ai-an10:88.1.1_0: “Mendicants, any mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, will, without a doubt, fall into one or other of these ten disasters.
ai-an10:88.1.3_0: They don’t achieve the unachieved. What they have achieved falls away. They don’t refine their good qualities. They overestimate their good qualities, or lead the spiritual life dissatisfied, or commit a corrupt offense, or contract a severe illness, or go mad and lose their mind. They feel lost when they die. And when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an10:88.1.4_0: Any mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, will, without a doubt, fall into one or other of these ten disasters.”
ai-an10:89.1.1_0: Then the mendicant Kokālika went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:89.1.1_2: Seated to one side, the mendicant Kokālika said to the Buddha,
ai-an10:89.1.2_0: “Sir, Sāriputta and Moggallāna have wicked desires. They’ve fallen under the sway of wicked desires.”
ai-an10:89.1.4_0: But they’ve confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna.
ai-an10:89.1.5_0: Have confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna, they’re good monks.”
ai-an10:89.2.1_0: For a second time, Kokālika said to the Buddha,
ai-an10:89.2.2_0: “Sir, may the Buddha please advise me for my wicked desires. Then Sāriputta and Moggallāna, having fallen under the sway of wicked desires.”
ai-an10:89.2.4_0: But they’ve confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna.
ai-an10:89.2.5_0: Have confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna, they’re good monks.”
ai-an10:89.3.1_0: For a third time, Kokālika said to the Buddha,
ai-an10:89.3.2_0: “Sir, may the Buddha please advise me for my wicked desires. Then Sāriputta and Moggallāna, having fallen under the sway of wicked desires.”
ai-an10:89.3.4_0: But they’ve confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna.
ai-an10:89.3.5_0: Have confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna, they’re good monks.”
ai-an10:89.4.1_0: Then Kokālika, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-an10:89.4.2_0: Soon after they had left, Kokālika obsessed with tubers, with all their trunks.
ai-an10:89.4.3_0: The boils grew to the size of mung beans, then chickpeas, then jujube seeds, then jujubes, then myrobalans, then unripe wood apples, then ripe wood apples.
ai-an10:89.4.4_0: He just laid down on banana leaves like a poisoned fish.
ai-an10:89.5.1_0: Then Tudu, Kokālika went to see Kokālika.
ai-an10:89.5.2_0: “Sāriputta, the Kokālika of Sāriputta and Moggallāna.
ai-an10:89.5.3_0: Have confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna, they’re good monks.”
ai-an10:89.5.6_0: “Hasn’t you come here, reverend? What exactly did you go to here?
ai-an10:89.5.7_0: See how far you have strayed!”
ai-an10:89.6.1_0: Then Tudu addressed Kokālika in verse:
ai-an10:89.7.1_0: For a manner of good qualities
ai-an10:89.9.5_0: can venerate the praised by the Holy One.

ai-an10:89.10.3_0: But someone who shines the hell,
ai-an10:89.10.4_0: but because they’re badly behaved badly.”
ai-an10:89.11.2_0: He was reborn in the Pink Lotus hell because of his resentment for Sāriputta and Moggallāna.
ai-an10:89.12.1_0: Then, late at night, the beautiful Brahmā Sahampati, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:89.12.2_0: “Sir, the monk who has passed away.
ai-an10:89.12.3_0: He was reborn in the pink lotus hell because of his resentment for Sāriputta and Moggallāna.”
ai-an10:89.12.5_0: Then he bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right side, before vanishing right there.
ai-an10:89.13.1_0: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened, repeating all the verses spoken. Then he added:
ai-an10:89.13.2_0: “Mendicants, tonight, the supreme being Sahampati, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me,
ai-an10:89.13.3_0: ‘Sir, the monk who has passed away.
ai-an10:89.13.4_0: He was reborn in the pink lotus hell because of his resentment for Sāriputta and Moggallāna.’
ai-an10:89.13.6_0: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”
ai-an10:89.14.1_0: When this was said, one of the mendicants asked the Buddha,
ai-an10:89.14.2_0: “Sir, how long is the life span in the Pink Lotus hell?”
ai-an10:89.14.3_0: “Mendicant, that pair of chiefs is in the Pink Lotus hell.
ai-an10:89.14.5_0: how many years, how many hundreds or thousands or hundreds of thousands of years it lasts.”
ai-an10:89.15.1_0: “But sir, can you give a simile?”
ai-an10:89.15.3_0: “Suppose there was a Kosalan cartload of twenty bushels of sesame seed. And at the end of every hundred years someone would remove a single seed from it.
ai-an10:89.15.4_0: By this means the huge heap of mustard seeds would be used up before the Kosalans.
ai-an10:89.15.5_0: Now, twenty lifetimes in the Abbuda hell equal one lifetime in the Nirabbuda hell.
ai-an10:89.15.6_0: Twenty lifetimes in the Nirabbuda hell equal one lifetime in the Ababa hell.
ai-an10:89.15.7_0: Twenty lifetimes in the Ababa hell equal one lifetime in the Aṭaṭa hell.
ai-an10:89.15.8_0: Twenty lifetimes in the Aṭaṭa hell equal one lifetime in the Ahaha hell.
ai-an10:89.15.9_0: Twenty lifetimes in the Ahaha hell equal one lifetime in the Yellow Lotus hell.
ai-an10:89.15.10_0: Twenty lifetimes in the Yellow Lotus hell equal one lifetime in the Sweet-Smelling hell.
ai-an10:89.15.11_0: Twenty lifetimes in the Sweet-Smelling hell equal one lifetime in the Blue Water Lily hell.
ai-an10:89.15.12_0: Twenty lifetimes in the Blue Water Lily hell equal one lifetime in the White Lotus hell.
ai-an10:89.15.13_0: Twenty lifetimes in the White Lotus hell equal one lifetime in the Pink Lotus hell.
ai-an10:89.15.14_0: The mendicant Kokālika has been reborn in the Pink Lotus hell because of his resentment for Sāriputta and Moggallāna.”
ai-an10:89.15.15_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-an10:89.15.16_0: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
ai-an10:89.16.1_0: For a manner of good qualities
ai-an10:89.18.5_0: can venerate the praised by the Holy One.
ai-an10:89.19.1_0: I know that your life span
ai-an10:89.19.3_0: But someone who shines the hell,
ai-an10:89.19.4_0: but because they’re badly behaved badly.”
ai-an10:90.0.3_0: 90. The Powers of One Who has Ended Defilements
ai-an10:90.1.1_0: Then Sāriputta went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:90.1.1_2: He bowed and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him,
ai-an10:90.1.2_0: “Sāriputta, when a mendicant with defilements ended has the defilements, the power of qualify them to claim:
ai-an10:90.2.1_0: “Sir, a mendicant who has ended the defilements has ten powers that qualify them to claim:
ai-an10:90.2.4_0: Firstly, a mendicant with defilements ended has clearly seen with right wisdom all conditions as truly impermanent.
ai-an10:90.2.5_0: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
ai-an10:90.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has clearly seen with right wisdom that sensual pleasures are truly like a pit of glowing coals. ...
ai-an10:90.3.2_0: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
ai-an10:90.4.1_0: Furthermore, the mind of a mendicant with defilements ended slants, slopes, and inclines to seclusion. They’re withdrawn, loving renunciation, and they’ve totally done with defiling influences.
ai-an10:90.4.2_0: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
ai-an10:90.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has well developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. ...
ai-an10:90.5.2_0: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
ai-an10:90.6.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has well developed the four right efforts. ...
ai-an10:90.6.2_0: the four bases of psychic power ...
ai-an10:90.6.6_0: noble eightfold path is well developed.
ai-an10:90.6.7_0: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
ai-an10:90.7.1_0: A mendicant who has ended the defilements has these ten powers that qualify them to claim:
ai-an10:90.7.4_0: The fourth sub-chapter on senior monks is finished.
ai-an10:90.8.3_0: One who does not want to endear himself
ai-an10:91.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:91.1.2_0: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:91.2.1_0: “These ten pleasure seekers are found in the world.
ai-an10:91.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:91.2.3_0: First, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means.
ai-an10:91.2.4_0: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased, nor share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.3.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means.
ai-an10:91.3.2_0: They make themselves happy and pleased, but don’t share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.4.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means.
ai-an10:91.4.2_0: They make themselves happy and pleased, and share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.5.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive.
ai-an10:91.5.2_0: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased, nor share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.6.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive.
ai-an10:91.6.2_0: They make themselves happy and pleased, but don't share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.7.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive.
ai-an10:91.7.2_0: They make themselves happy and pleased, and share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.8.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means.
ai-an10:91.8.2_0: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased, nor share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.9.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means.
ai-an10:91.9.2_0: They make themselves happy and pleased, but don’t share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.10.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means.
ai-an10:91.10.2_0: They make themselves happy and pleased, and share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.10.3_0: But they enjoy that wealth tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.
ai-an10:91.11.1_0: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means.
ai-an10:91.11.2_0: They make themselves happy and pleased, and share it and make merit.
ai-an10:91.11.3_0: And they enjoy that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape.
ai-an10:91.12.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means, and who doesn’t make themselves happy and pleased, nor share it and make merit. They may be criticized on three grounds.
ai-an10:91.12.2_0: They seek wealth using legitimate means, and criticized on this is the first ground.
ai-an10:91.12.3_0: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.12.4_0: They don’t share it and make merit. This is the third ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.12.5_0: This pleasure seeker may be criticized on these three grounds.
ai-an10:91.13.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, but doesn’t share it and make merit. They may be criticized on two grounds, and praised on one.
ai-an10:91.13.2_0: They seek wealth using legitimate means, and criticized on this is the first ground.
ai-an10:91.13.3_0: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the one ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.13.4_0: They don’t share it and make merit. This is the second ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.13.5_0: This pleasure seeker may be criticized on these two grounds, and praised on this one.
ai-an10:91.14.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit. They may be criticized on one ground, and praised on two.
ai-an10:91.14.2_0: They seek wealth using illegitimate, one ground for criticism. This is the one ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.14.3_0: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the first ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.14.4_0: They share it and make merit. This is the second ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.14.5_0: This pleasure seeker may be criticized on this one ground, and praised on these two.
ai-an10:91.15.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive, and who doesn’t make themselves happy and pleased, nor share it and make merit. They may be praised on one ground, and criticized on three.
ai-an10:91.15.2_0: They seek wealth using illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and praised on one. This is the one ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.15.3_0: They seek wealth using legitimate means, and criticized on this is the first ground.
ai-an10:91.15.4_0: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.15.5_0: They don’t share it and make merit. This is the third ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.15.6_0: This pleasure seeker may be praised on this one ground, and criticized on these three.
ai-an10:91.16.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, but doesn’t share it and make merit. They may be praised on two grounds, and criticized on two.
ai-an10:91.16.2_0: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased. This is the first ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.16.3_0: They seek wealth using legitimate means, and criticized on this is the first ground.
ai-an10:91.16.4_0: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.16.5_0: They don’t share it and make merit. This is the second ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.16.6_0: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these two grounds, and criticized on these two.
ai-an10:91.17.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and make merit. They may be praised on three grounds, and criticized on one.
ai-an10:91.17.2_0: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased. This is the first ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.17.3_0: They seek wealth using illegitimate, one ground for criticism. This is the one ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.17.4_0: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.17.5_0: They share it and make merit. This is the third ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.17.6_0: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these three grounds, and criticized on this one.
ai-an10:91.18.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who doesn’t make themselves happy and pleased, nor share it and make merit. They may be praised on one ground and criticized on two.
ai-an10:91.18.2_0: They seek wealth using illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and praised on one. This is the one ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.18.3_0: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased. This is the first ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.18.4_0: They don’t share it and make merit. This is the second ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.18.5_0: This pleasure seeker may be praised on this one ground, and criticized on these two.
ai-an10:91.19.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, but doesn’t share it and make merit. They may be praised on two grounds and criticized on one.
ai-an10:91.19.2_0: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased. This is the first ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.19.3_0: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.19.4_0: They don’t share it and make merit. This is the one ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.19.5_0: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these two grounds, and criticized on this one.
ai-an10:91.20.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit. But they enjoy that wealth tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape. They may be praised on three grounds and criticized on one.
ai-an10:91.20.2_0: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased. This is the first ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.20.3_0: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.20.4_0: They share it and make merit. This is the third ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.20.5_0: They enjoy that wealth tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape. This is the one ground for criticism.
ai-an10:91.20.6_0: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these three grounds, and criticized on this one.
ai-an10:91.21.1_0: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit. But they enjoy that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape. They may be praised on four grounds and criticized on one.
ai-an10:91.21.2_0: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased. This is the first ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.21.3_0: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.21.4_0: They share it and make merit. This is the third ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.21.5_0: They enjoy that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape. This is the fourth ground for praise.
ai-an10:91.21.6_0: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these four grounds.
ai-an10:91.22.1_0: These are the ten pleasure seekers found in the world.
ai-an10:91.22.2_0: The pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit, and who uses that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the ten.
ai-an10:91.22.3_0: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee.
ai-an10:91.22.3_1: And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.
ai-an10:91.23.1_0: In the same way, the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit, and who uses that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the ten.”
ai-an10:91.23.2_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-an10:92.1.1_0: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:92.2.1_0: “Householder, when a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and comprehended the noble cycle with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
ai-an10:92.2.2_0: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm.
ai-an10:92.2.2_1: I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’
ai-an10:92.3.1_0: What are the five dangers that dangers and threats?
ai-an10:92.3.2_0: Anyone who kills living creatures creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from killing living creatures creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an10:92.3.3_0: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who refrains from killing living creatures.
ai-an10:92.4.4_0: Anyone who uses alcoholic drinks that cause negligence creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an10:92.4.5_0: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who refrains from using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an10:92.4.6_0: These are the five dangers and threats.
ai-an10:92.5.1_0: What are the four factors of stream-entry that they have?
ai-an10:92.5.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha ...
ai-an10:92.5.3_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-an10:92.5.4_0: they have experiential confidence in the teaching:
ai-an10:92.5.5_0: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’
ai-an10:92.5.7_0: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’
ai-an10:92.5.8_0: And a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.
ai-an10:92.5.9_0: These are the four factors of stream-entry that they have.
ai-an10:92.6.1_0: What is the noble cycle that they have clearly seen and comprehended with wisdom?
ai-an10:92.6.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:
ai-an10:92.6.3_0: ‘When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
ai-an10:92.6.4_0: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
ai-an10:92.6.5_0: ignorance is a condition for choices.
ai-an10:92.6.7_0: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
ai-an10:92.6.8_0: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields
ai-an10:92.6.9_0: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
ai-an10:92.6.10_0: Contact is a condition for feeling.
ai-an10:92.6.11_0: Feeling is a condition for craving;
ai-an10:92.6.12_0: Craving is a condition for grasping.
ai-an10:92.6.13_0: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
ai-an10:92.6.14_0: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
ai-an10:92.6.15_0: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
ai-an10:92.6.16_0: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
ai-an10:92.6.17_0: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease. ...
ai-an10:92.6.18_0: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
ai-an10:92.6.19_0: This is the noble cycle that they have clearly seen and comprehended with wisdom.
ai-an10:92.7.1_0: When a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and comprehended the noble cycle with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
ai-an10:92.7.2_0: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm.
ai-an10:92.7.2_1: I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’”
ai-an10:93.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:93.1.2_0: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika left Sāvatthī in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.
ai-an10:93.1.4_0: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha,
ai-an10:93.1.6_0: For there are wrong time to see the esteemed mendicants.
ai-an10:93.1.8_0: Why don’t I go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”
ai-an10:93.2.1_0: Then he went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths.
ai-an10:93.2.2_0: Now at that time, the wanderers who follow other paths had come together, making an uproar, a dreadful racket as they sat and talked about all kinds of unworthy topics.
ai-an10:93.2.3_0: They saw Anāthapiṇḍika coming off in the distance,
ai-an10:93.2.5_0: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound.
ai-an10:93.2.6_0: The householder Anāthapiṇḍika, a disciple of the ascetic Gotama, is coming into our monastery.
ai-an10:93.2.7_0: He is included among the white-clothed lay disciples of the ascetic Gotama, who is residing in Sāvatthī.
ai-an10:93.2.8_0: Such venerables like the quiet, are educated to be quiet, and praise the quiet.
ai-an10:93.2.9_0: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.”
ai-an10:93.3.2_0: Then Anāthapiṇḍika went up to them,
ai-an10:93.3.2_1: and they exchanged greetings with the wanderers there.
ai-an10:93.3.3_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
ai-an10:93.3.4_0: “Tell us, householder, what is the view of the ascetic Gotama?”
ai-an10:93.3.5_0: “Sirs, I don’t know all his views.”
ai-an10:93.4.1_0: “Well then, since it seems you don’t know all the views of the ascetic Gotama,
ai-an10:93.4.2_0: tell us, what are the views of the mendicants?”
ai-an10:93.4.3_0: “Sirs, I don’t know all the mendicants’ views.”
ai-an10:93.5.1_0: “Well then, since it seems you don’t know all the views of the ascetic Gotama or of the mendicants,
ai-an10:93.5.2_0: Tell us, householder, what is your view?”
ai-an10:93.5.3_0: “Sirs, it’s not hard for me to explain what my views are.
ai-an10:93.5.4_0: But please, let the venerables explain their own convictions first. Afterwards it won’t be hard for me to explain my views.”
ai-an10:93.6.1_0: When he said this, one of the wanderers said to him,
ai-an10:93.6.2_0: “The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.6.3_0: That’s how I have such view, householder,.”
ai-an10:93.7.1_0: And the wanderer Anāthapiṇḍika said this,
ai-an10:93.7.2_0: “The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.7.3_0: That’s how I have such view, householder,.”
ai-an10:93.8.1_0: And the wanderer Anāthapiṇḍika said this,
ai-an10:93.8.4_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing ...” ...
ai-an10:93.8.5_0: “The soul and the body are different things ...” ...
ai-an10:93.8.7_0: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death ...” ...
ai-an10:93.8.8_0: “A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death ...” ...
ai-an10:93.8.9_0: “A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.8.10_0: That’s how I have such view, householder,.”
ai-an10:93.9.1_0: When this was said, Anāthapiṇḍika said this,
ai-an10:93.9.2_0: “Sirs, regarding the venerable who said this:
ai-an10:93.9.3_0: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.9.4_0: That’s how I have such view,
ai-an10:93.9.5_0: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.
ai-an10:93.9.6_0: From there are beings who are attached to the convictions.
ai-an10:93.9.7_0: Whatever is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.9.9_0: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.
ai-an10:93.10.1_0: But, sir, if Venerable doesn’t say this:
ai-an10:93.10.2_0: ‘The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.10.3_0: That’s how I have such view,
ai-an10:93.10.4_0: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.
ai-an10:93.10.5_0: From there are beings who are attached to the convictions.
ai-an10:93.10.6_0: Whatever is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.10.8_0: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.
ai-an10:93.11.1_0: But, sir, if Venerable doesn’t say this:
ai-an10:93.11.4_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing ...” ...
ai-an10:93.11.5_0: “The soul and the body are different things ...” ...
ai-an10:93.11.7_0: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death ...” ...
ai-an10:93.11.8_0: “A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death ...” ...
ai-an10:93.11.9_0: “A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.11.10_0: That’s how I have such view,
ai-an10:93.11.11_0: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.
ai-an10:93.11.12_0: From there are beings who are attached to the convictions.
ai-an10:93.11.13_0: Whatever is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.11.15_0: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.”
ai-an10:93.12.1_0: When he said this the wanderers said to him,
ai-an10:93.12.2_0: “Householder, we’ve each explained our own convictions.
ai-an10:93.12.3_0: Tell us, householder, what is your view?”
ai-an10:93.12.4_0: “Sir, what is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.12.6_0: And what’s suffering is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.
ai-an10:93.13.1_0: “Householder, anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.13.3_0: What you cling to and hold to is just suffering.”
ai-an10:93.14.1_0: “Sir, what is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.14.3_0: And I’ve truly seen clearly with right wisdom that what’s suffering is not mine, I am not this, it’s not my self.
ai-an10:93.14.4_0: And I truly understand the escape beyond that.”
ai-an10:93.15.1_0: When this was said, those wanderers sat silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.
ai-an10:93.15.2_0: Seeing this, Anāthapiṇḍika got up from his seat.
ai-an10:93.15.2_2: and informed the Buddha of all they had discussed.
ai-an10:93.15.4_0: That’s how you should legitimately and completely refute those foolish men from time to time.”
ai-an10:93.16.1_0: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired the householder Anāthapiṇḍika with a Dhamma talk,
ai-an10:93.16.2_0: after which Anāthapiṇḍika got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha before leaving.
ai-an10:93.17.1_0: Then, not long after Anāthapiṇḍika had left, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-an10:93.17.2_0: “Mendicants, even a mendicant who has ordained for a hundred years in this teaching and training would legitimately and completely refute those wanderers who follow other paths just as the householder Anāthapiṇḍika did.”
ai-an10:94.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā lotus pond.
ai-an10:94.1.2_0: Then the householder Vajjiyamāhita left Sāvatthī in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.
ai-an10:94.1.4_0: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha,
ai-an10:94.1.6_0: For there are wrong time to see the esteemed mendicants.
ai-an10:94.1.8_0: Why don’t I go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”
ai-an10:94.2.1_0: Then he went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths.
ai-an10:94.2.2_0: Now at that time, the wanderers who follow other paths had come together, making an uproar, a dreadful racket as they sat and talked about all kinds of unworthy topics.
ai-an10:94.3.1_0: They saw Vajjiyamāhita coming off in the distance,
ai-an10:94.3.2_0: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound.
ai-an10:94.3.3_0: The householder Vajjiyamāhita, a disciple of the ascetic Gotama, is coming into our monastery.
ai-an10:94.3.4_0: He is included among the white-clothed lay disciples of the ascetic Gotama, who is residing near Campā.
ai-an10:94.3.5_0: Such venerables like the quiet, are educated to be quiet, and praise the quiet.
ai-an10:94.3.6_0: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.”
ai-an10:94.4.2_0: Then Vajjiyamāhita went up to them,
ai-an10:94.4.2_1: and they exchanged greetings with the wanderers there.
ai-an10:94.4.3_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
ai-an10:94.4.4_0: “Is it really true, householder? Does the ascetic Gotama criticize all forms of mortification? Does he categorically condemn and denounce those self-mortifiers who live rough?”
ai-an10:94.4.5_0: “No, sirs, the ascetic Gotama does not criticize all forms of mortification. Nor does he categorically condemn and denounce those self-mortifiers who live rough.
ai-an10:94.4.6_0: The Buddha criticizes where it is due, and praises where it is due.
ai-an10:94.4.7_0: In doing so he is one who speaks after analyzing the question,
ai-an10:94.4.8_0: and is not definitive on this point.”
ai-an10:94.5.1_0: When he said this, one of the wanderers said to him,
ai-an10:94.5.2_0: “Hold on, householder! That ascetic Gotama who you praise is an exterminator who refrains from making statements.”
ai-an10:94.5.3_0: “On this point, also, I reasonably respond to the venerables.
ai-an10:94.5.4_0: The Buddha has stated ‘This is skillful’ and
ai-an10:94.5.6_0: So when it comes to what is skillful and unskillful the Buddha makes a statement.
ai-an10:94.5.7_0: He is not an exterminator who refrains from making statements.”
ai-an10:94.6.1_0: When this was said, those wanderers sat silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.
ai-an10:94.6.2_0: Seeing this, Vajjiyamāhita got up from his seat. He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side,
ai-an10:94.6.3_0: and informed the Buddha of all they had discussed.
ai-an10:94.7.2_0: That’s how you should legitimately and completely refute those foolish men from time to time.
ai-an10:94.7.3_0: Householder, I don’t say that all mortifications should be undergone.
ai-an10:94.7.4_0: But I don’t say that no mortifications should be undergone.
ai-an10:94.7.5_0: I don’t say that all observances should be undertaken.
ai-an10:94.7.6_0: But I don’t say that no observances should be undertaken.
ai-an10:94.7.7_0: I don’t say that all efforts should be tried.
ai-an10:94.7.8_0: But I don’t say that no efforts should be tried.
ai-an10:94.7.9_0: I don’t say that everything should be given up.
ai-an10:94.7.10_0: But I don’t say that nothing should be given up.
ai-an10:94.7.11_0: I don’t say that you should be liberated with all kinds of freedom.
ai-an10:94.7.12_0: But I don’t say that you should not be liberated with any kind of freedom.
ai-an10:94.8.1_0: When undergoing certain mortifications, unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline. I say that you shouldn’t undergo those mortifications.
ai-an10:94.8.2_0: When undergoing certain mortifications, unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow. I say that you should undergo those mortifications.
ai-an10:94.9.1_0: When undertaking certain observances, unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline. I say that you shouldn’t undertake those observances.
ai-an10:94.9.2_0: When undertaking certain observances, unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow. I say that you should undertake those observances.
ai-an10:94.10.1_0: When trying certain efforts, unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline. I say that you shouldn’t try those efforts.
ai-an10:94.10.2_0: When trying certain efforts, unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow. I say that you should try those efforts.
ai-an10:94.11.1_0: When giving up certain things, unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline. I say that you shouldn’t give up those things.
ai-an10:94.11.2_0: When giving up certain things, unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow. I say that you should give up those things.
ai-an10:94.12.1_0: When being liberated with certain kinds of freedom, unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline. I say that you shouldn’t be liberated with those kinds of freedom.
ai-an10:94.12.2_0: When being liberated with certain kinds of freedom, unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow. I say that you should be liberated with those kinds of freedom.”
ai-an10:94.13.1_0: After Vajjiyamāhita had been educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired with a Dhamma talk by the Buddha, he got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha before leaving.
ai-an10:94.14.1_0: Then, not long after Vajjiyamāhita had left, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-an10:94.14.2_0: “Mendicants, even a mendicant who for a long time has had little dust in their eye in this teaching and training would legitimately and completely refute those wanderers who follow other paths just as the householder Vajjiyamāhita did.”
ai-an10:95.1.1_0: Then the wanderer Uttiya went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an10:95.1.2_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
ai-an10:95.1.2_1: He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
ai-an10:95.1.3_0: “Master Gotama, is this right: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-an10:95.1.4_0: “This has not been declared by me, Uttiya.”
ai-an10:95.1.5_0: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’”
ai-an10:95.2.1_0: “Then is this right: ‘The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-an10:95.2.2_0: “This too has not been declared by me.”
ai-an10:95.2.3_0: ‘The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’”

ai-an10:95.3.10_0: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, anything else is wrong’?”

ai-an10:95.6.10_0: “A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly”.
ai-an10:95.6.11_0: So what exactly has been declared by Master Gotama?”
ai-an10:95.7.1_0: “Uttiya, I teach my disciples from my own insight in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.”
ai-an10:95.8.1_0: “But when Master Gotama teaches in this way, is the whole world saved, or half, or a third?”
ai-an10:95.9.2_0: “The wanderer Uttiya must not get the harmful misconception:
ai-an10:95.9.3_0: ‘When the ascetic Gotama was asked this all-important question he falters without answering. He just can’t do it!’
ai-an10:95.9.4_0: That would be for his lasting harm and suffering.”
ai-an10:95.10.1_0: Then Ānanda said to the wanderer Uttiya,
ai-an10:95.10.2_0: “Well then, Reverend Uttiya, I shall give you a simile.
ai-an10:95.10.3_0: For by means of a simile some sensible people understand the meaning of what is said.
ai-an10:95.10.4_0: Suppose there was a king’s frontier citadel with fortified embankments, ramparts, and arches, and a single gate.
ai-an10:95.10.5_0: And it has a gatekeeper who is astute, competent, and clever. He keeps strangers out and lets known people in.
ai-an10:95.10.6_0: As he walks around the patrol path, he walks without a hole or standing.
ai-an10:95.10.6_1: Not even if she makes a cat, she does not see, even one who could stands or branch, even one with a catch.
ai-an10:95.10.7_0: He doesn’t know how many creatures enter or leave the citadel.
ai-an10:95.10.8_1: ‘Any creatures enter the town or city through come out of this pond, or at all that very door.
ai-an10:95.11.1_0: In the same way, it’s not the Realized One’s concern whether the whole world is made by oneself:
ai-an10:95.11.1_1: ‘The world is saved by this, or half, or a third.
ai-an10:95.11.2_1: ‘All the world—whether in the world, middle, or junior—ghe will give up the five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom. Their mind will develop the seven awakening factors. And they truly develop the seven awakening factors.
ai-an10:95.11.3_0: That’s how they’re saved from the world, in the past, future, or present.
ai-an10:95.11.4_0: Uttiya, you were just asking the Buddha the same question as before in a different way.

ai-an10:97.0.3_0: 97. Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods
ai-an10:97.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with ten factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an10:97.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an10:97.3.1_0: They’re very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned.
ai-an10:97.4.1_0: They have good friends, companions, and associates.
ai-an10:97.5.1_0: They have right view, possessing right perspective.
ai-an10:97.6.1_0: he wields the many kinds of psychic power:
